column1: 4104740820,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-data-analyst-at-scalapay-4104740820?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=oKn6NLf7YOZDFecaTYm0EA%3D%3D&trackingId=qdQSDyHNUfL36SrDfqC0cA%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Data Analyst,Scalapay,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Thanks to our innovative BuyNow PayLater payment solution, Scalapay is transforming the way more than 6.5 million customers buy online and in-store, empowering 8,000+ merchants (online and in-store) to give their customers magical shopping experiences.

Being only 3 years old didnâ€™t stop us from becoming a unicorn ðŸ¦„ We have raised over $700mln and we did this thanks to a team built around our 4 core values: #MakeItHappen #PlayAsATeam #StayCurious #FocusOnCustomer.
This is where your magic happens. If you love it, Scalapay it â™¥

Our data team seeks a Business Intelligence Data Analyst who will champion a 'data-first' mindset, ensuring precise measurement and reporting of relevant metrics. This role collaborates closely with Scalapayâ€™s key Business Units such as Product, Marketing and Sales, employing technical expertise to translate concepts into concrete outcomes.
Serve as the data point of reference for our key Business Units, providing them with necessary support
Use advanced analytical tools to assess and interpret sales and marketing data, measuring the effectiveness of activities and pinpointing areas for improvement
Build and maintain comprehensive reports and dashboards for our teams to facilitate data-driven decision-making
Translate business questions into analytical solutions, providing actionable insights
Ensure accuracy and reliability in measuring key performance indicators (KPIs) and the underlying data
Identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement in order to propose data-driven recommendations to optimise marketing strategies and sales processes
Conduct hands-on work with data, including data cleansing, transformation, and validation
Help us extend a data-driven mindset throughout Scalapay
Be an active member of the Data team, helping to develop and enhance our suite of Business Intelligence tooling.
Youâ€™ll be great for this role if:
You have a minimum of 3 years of experience in a data-driven role, ideally with a background in startups or fintech
You have strong SQL skills, Python is a plus
You are proficient in data visualisation tools and data storytelling
You have a background in statistics and can conduct experiments or validate hypotheses
You are fluent in Italian and English: you must be totally confident talking and sharing results in English in a sharp and concise way
You demonstrate outstanding communication skills, both verbally and in writing. You excel at simplifying complex topics into straightforward solutions and ideas
Youâ€™re more than data-driven, you are obsessed with data!
Attractive packages based on skills and experience - the salary we have for this position is up to 40'000â‚¬ (Gross Annual Base)
International environment with significant challenges to be met every day
Lots of opportunities to work with a team of industry tech leaders who are focused on delivering products that offer exceptional user experiences
Personalised support to accelerate your professional growth and take ownership of the products you deliver: we want to help you grow!
Latest technologies and being encouraged to bring your flair to the role.
Initial Chat: A brief conversation with our Talent Acquisition team
Hiring Manager Interview: A deep dive into your experience and motivation for the role
Case Study: A skills-based test with a debriefing session involving key stakeholders, conducted in our Milan office
Final Chat with Simone (CEO): An opportunity to discuss Scalapayâ€™s values and assess cultural alignment.
Want to learn more? Don't hesitate to explore our Careers website, our LinkedIn and Glassdoor pages.
Pro tip: send your CV in English ðŸ˜‰
Super Pro tip: we know that application processes can be scary and frustrating butâ€¦ we look for talent, not people that tick all our boxes.
We believe in the power of diversity: Scalapay is an Equal Opportunity Employer for any minority, disability, gender identity or sexual orientation.

4130498632,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-subito-4130498632?position=5&pageNum=0&refId=oKn6NLf7YOZDFecaTYm0EA%3D%3D&trackingId=Sar6z%2FKwO1z7e%2BqPkREOJg%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Subito,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Weâ€™re Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

Weâ€™re all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever theyâ€™re looking for in their local communities â€“ whether itâ€™s a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.
What Youâ€™ll Do & Who You Are
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subitoâ€™s team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.
The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.
The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so itâ€™s more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding
4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences
Prior experience in a digital company
Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
Hands on experience on Data Science projects
Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
â€˜Work from anywhereâ€™ weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a â‚¬8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you donâ€™t meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they donâ€™t meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

Weâ€™re Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

Weâ€™re all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever theyâ€™re looking for in their local communities â€“ whether itâ€™s a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.

What Youâ€™ll Do &
column2:
Who You Are

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subitoâ€™s team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.

The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.

The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Your Typical Day

  • Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so itâ€™s more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
  • Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
  • Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
  • Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
  • Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
  • Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding

Skills Required

  • 4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
  • Highly proficient with SQL
  • Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
  • Applied knowledge of statistical techniques
  • Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences

Plus

  • Good English proficiency level
  • Prior experience in a digital company
  • Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
  • Hands on experience on Data Science projects

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation package
  • Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
  • Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
  • Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
  • Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
  • â€˜Work from anywhereâ€™ weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
  • Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a â‚¬8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you donâ€™t meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they donâ€™t meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attivitÃ , dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa Ã¨ CPM, una realtÃ  internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunitÃ  di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Unâ€™esperienza che ti metterÃ  a contatto con i brand e le aziende piÃ¹ importanti in Italia.
Candidati eâ€¦ magari ci vediamo a bordo!
Ti offriamo unâ€™esperienza in linea con la tua passione: i numeri.

Per te abbiamo uno stage come Data Analyst allâ€™interno del nostro team dedicato ad uno dei nostri clienti. Potrai formarti in un ambito molto richiesto dal mercato del lavoro e sperimentare il tuo interesse per i dati, i brand e il field marketing.

Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Lo stage Ã¨ retribuito (sono previsti anche i buoni pasto) e ha una durata di 6 mesi con possibilitÃ  di proroga o eventuale assunzione.
Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?
La tua attivitÃ  riguarda la redazione della reportistica utile per lâ€™analisi e la presentazione dei dati a un nostro cliente di livello internazionale. In particolare ti insegneremo a:
verificare e pianificare le coperture dei punti vendita da parte dei merchandiser
analizzare i dati di vendita e di tanti altri parametri
valutare i dati tramite indicatori chiave di performance (KPI)
preparare presentazioni in PowerPoint di riepilogo dei report realizzati.
Non sarai solo ma sempre supportato da figure esperte che sapranno trasmetterti le loro competenze e i loro segreti.
Per fare uno stage in CPM come Data Analyst puÃ² essere utile un percorso di studi di economia o in ambito IT, ma lâ€™unico vero must Ã¨ la voglia di imparare e mettersi in gioco.
hai la passione per i numeri
te la cavi con excel e altri programmi informatici
Ricerchiamo una persona che s'identifichi con i valori CPM: condivisione e propensione al lavoro di team, curiositÃ , integrazione, lavorare per obiettivi sia individuali che di gruppo.

Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999, n.68 Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.

Elaborazione e analisi dei dati provenienti dal sistema gestionale aziendale (Cegid).

conoscenza di base di strumenti per l'analisi dei dati e per la business intelligence

ResponsabilitÃ  principali:

  • Elaborazione e analisi dei dati provenienti dal sistema gestionale aziendale (Cegid).
  • Realizzazione di report e dashboard per il monitoraggio delle performance.
  • Analisi dati: Sell-in e sell-out, Incassi, KPI aziendali, Venduto per categoria e prodotto.

Requisiti richiesti:

Data Science Analyst

Gallarate (2 days per week in the office)


Our client


Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate â‚¬22.9bn revenue.


With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Libertyâ€™s, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, HermÃ¨s, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.


Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.


The role


Weâ€™re hiring for a Data Science Analyst to join the Data &
column2:
Business Intelligence team.


This role will support with the implementation of data science innovation projects that lead to an improvement in customer experience and economic value for the business and its partners.


Some of the responsibilities include


  • Support with the roll out of Data Science projects for global retailer partners.
  • Test the quality and relevance of projects during early stages of the project lifecycle.
  • Collaborate with Data Science teams in the development of new products, applying cutting edge AI and ML solutions to products.
  • Support with the creation of Corporate Data Governance Policies.
  • Function as the main stakeholder of data quality audits for data science project development.


To apply, you should have


  • Experience working as a Data Analyst on big data and / or data science projects.
  • Intermediate proficiency in SQL.
  • Experience using a data visualisation tool such as Tableau, MicroStrategy, or Power BI.
  • Business and technical requirements analysis experience.
  • Experience with business process modelling / mapping, methodology development, and data modelling.
  • The ability to collect, analyse, translate, and dissect complex topics and business requirements into technical specifications.
  • Strong stakeholder management experience, ideally with experience working in a global multicultural environment.
  • Basic Python is desirable.


The perks


  • Restaurant ticket

  • Agile working model â€“ ability to work remotely 3 days per week.

Nati nel 2003, abbiamo raccolto e valorizzato lâ€™esperienza storica della consulenza e abbiamo aggiunto due ingredienti chiave: lâ€™innovazione e la digitalizzazione.

Analisi funzionali in ambito dati e IT

Avrai la possibilitÃ  di metterti alla prova in contesti progettuali diversi in termini di ambito, natura delle attivitÃ  e stakeholders coinvolti. Vedrai valorizzato il tuo spirito di iniziativa, la tua passione, lâ€™autonomia e la capacitÃ  di assumerti responsabilitÃ  e metterti in gioco.

We are looking for

We are looking for a driven and enthusiastic Data Analyst (m/w/d) , who desires to contribute to the growth and success of our Product Team.

Your role in BizAway

  • You manage and improve our current reporting system, supporting all internal needs for Data visualization of data findings through charts, graphs, and dashboards to make our data understandable.
  • You learn all aspects of the travel industry from Finance, Products, Sales and Service/Operations perspective, translating data into actionable insights resulting in verifiable reporting.
  • By having domain expertise in our industry, you engage with Business and Strategy stakeholders to help define KPIs, including how data will be captured, shared, and leveraged across our departments.
  • You contribute to creating the base foundations of a comprehensive source of truth through data modeling actions

Your Basic Qualifications

  • Demonstrated experience with BI Data Visualization tools (Qlik preferred)
  • Data analysis, presentation, and visualization experience
  • Strong communication skills required
  • Ability to work alone or in a team as required
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field is preferred
  • Confidence in English (written and spoken level B2).

We are also interested in

  • Experience with ETL tools (AWS Glue, Airflow, Talend)
  • Understanding of machine learning concepts
  • Knowledge of programming languages such as Python

column1: Nel 2015 ci siamo imbarcati in una missione: fornire un'assicurazione auto di grande valore progettata per tutti. E abbiamo fatto molta strada, creando una cultura in cui possiamo alimentare il successo reciproco. Ma abbiamo bisogno della tua esperienza mentre ci dirigiamo in una nuova e entusiasmante direzione.
Probabilmente stai pensando... â€œSembra abbastanza interessanteâ€. Siamo d'accordo!

Oltre a ottimi colleghi e progetti coinvolgenti, ci sono molti modi in cui possiamo aiutarti a fare il miglior lavoro della tua vita. Abbiamo modellato la nostra offerta ponendo l'attenzione sul benessere, sull'autonomia e sullo sviluppo del dipendente. Vediamo i benefici come il carburante che ti darÃ  il potere di avere successo, se deciderai di intraprendere questo viaggio con noi.

ðŸ¤¸ðŸ½â€â™‚ï¸ Lavorare nel modo che funziona per te Crediamo nella flessibilitÃ  e nel bilanciamento tra vita privata e lavoro. Che tu preferisca lavorare in ufficio, da casa o con una combinazione di entrambi, ti aiuteremo a trovare un equilibrio che funzioni meglio per te. Abbiamo persino una politica che ti consente di lavorare da qualsiasi location per 30 giorni all'anno. Confidiamo in te per guidarci avanti.
ðŸ La libertÃ  di esplorare le possibilitÃ  Forse in Prima ci muoviamo velocemente, ma lo facciamo insieme. Siamo impegnati nella tua crescita
column2: ti daremo accesso a piattaforme per l'insegnamento e l'apprendimento. Avrai sessioni di feedback regolari con il tuo responsabile per stabilire un piano di crescita personale.

column1: ðŸŒˆ La nostra formula vincente: felicitÃ  e performance elevate Dall'assicurazione medica privata alle iscrizioni scontate in palestra e alle iniziative per il benessere: siamo qui per supportarti. Sappiamo quanto sia importante la tua salute e il tuo benessere, quindi faremo uno sforzo in piÃ¹ per aiutarti quando possibile.
Se sembra che abbiamo qualcosa che possa interessarti, vediamo se hai le competenze che stiamo cercando!
Siamo alla ricerca di talenti da inserire come Data Analyst all'interno del dipartimento Online Sales.

In questo ruolo avrai il compito di analizzare lâ€™intera journey di vendita del cliente che avviene attraverso tutte le properties digitali (sito, App, aggregatori, customer care, partnership), dalla prima interazione al rinnovo. Dovrai mappare le dinamiche e le abitudini degli utenti nei vari touchpoint con Prima, al fine di migliorare le performance degli attuali canali di vendita, nonchÃ© di migliorare il valore generato da ciascun cliente. Il tuo lavoro influirÃ  direttamente sulla strategia di vendita diretta e i risultati economici dellâ€™azienda, una chiave fondamentale per la crescita e la sostenibilitÃ  di Prima.
Nello Specifico, Sarai Responsabile Di Queste AttivitÃ
Impostare sistema di analisi per attivitÃ  in termini di risultati e performance con estrazioni da DB
Creare modelli analitici di monitoraggio utilizzando Tableau e Python per supportare le decisione strategiche del team
Collaborare, supportare e comunicare con i vari stakeholders dati e risultati inerenti alle attivitÃ  del canale di vendita online
Analizzare le performance di vendita per canale, tipologia di prodotto e cliente, al fine di individuare opportunitÃ  di crescita e di eliminare possibili frizioni allâ€™acquisto
Ottimizzare la journey del cliente, analizzando le diverse interazioni lungo tutti i touchpoint con il cliente, al fine di migliorare massimizzare i KPI di vendita
Implementare modelli di attribuzione per isolare e misurare lâ€™impatto delle varie iniziative online
Analizzare l'impatto atteso da nuove iniziative/prodotti, supportando la costruzione dei relativi business case.
Buona conoscenza nella creazione di dataset utilizzando linguaggi per lâ€™estrazione di dati (MySQL, Redshift, PostgreSQL)
CapacitÃ  di fare analisi e creare modelli utilizzando Python, Tableau e Excel
ProattivitÃ  e voglia di mettersi in gioco, allâ€™interno di un team nuovo, dinamico e trasversale
CapacitÃ  logiche e analitiche: padroneggi velocemente argomenti molto complessi e riesci a modellizzarne le dinamiche e i rapporti causa-effetto.
CuriositÃ  e passione: hai uno sguardo critico e ti chiedi sempre come puoi migliorare le cose. Sei attratto dalle nuove tecnologie e da tutte le tematiche che abbracciano lâ€™innovazione.

ElasticitÃ  ed attitudine al cambiamento: reagisci positivamente ai cambiamenti, accettando le sfide continue che incontri. Sei elastico e ben predisposto a lavorare con persone dal background e forma mentis diversi dai tuoi.
Oltre ai requisiti di base, valuteremo con particolare attenzione queste caratteristiche:

imparando e crescendo con un team di alto livello intorno a te. Prima Ã¨ un luogo in cui non importa chi sei o qual Ã¨ il tuo ruolo, la tua voce ha un valore.

At TrueLayer, we're building the future of payments. We're on a mission to take on outdated payment methods with a solution designed for today's online, on-demand economy. By removing friction at the heart of commerce â€” the payment â€” we're making it faster, safer, and smarter for everyone.

To date, we've raised $300 million from world-renowned investors including Stripe, Tiger Global, Addition, and Tencent. With offices in London, Milan, and Dublin, we're trusted by industry leaders like RyanAir and JustEat Takeaway. But this is just the beginning.

We're reimagining how the world pays, invests, shops, and saves. We're transforming payments for industries like e-Commerce and iGaming, redefining what's possible with technology and innovation. Now, we're looking for people who are ready to help us build a brand that changes an industry.
TrueLayer's new Analytics team empowers our entire organisation to make strategic decisions based on a scalable data infrastructure, coupled with commercial insight and impeccable leadership skills.

A Data Analyst at TrueLayer works in cross-functional teams and partners with stakeholders across the company, including Growth, Client Care, Engineering and Product, to unlock the power of data and drive strategic decision-making. You'll spend your time building datasets, conducting analysis and sharing learnings with teams.

In return, we'll empower our Data Analysts to own Analytics planning, and make key decisions around data infrastructure and analytics best practices. Working in an exciting and growing team of Analysts, Data Engineers and an Analytics Lead, your analysis and insight will be the fuel that drives our journey to power the new era of financial innovation globally.
What we expect from you as a Data Analyst:
Collaborate with business teams such as Commercial, Product, Client Care, Engineering and Operations to understand and help define their analytics requirements
Build and maintain data models for key business use cases, through DBT
Drive the collection and integration of new and existing data sources
Be a BI subject matter expert, conduct deep analyses and communicate insights to the business
Help cultivate a data-driven culture by providing TrueLayeristas with the knowledge and tools required to self-serve
Relevant experience that aligns with the key requirements of the role, demonstrating a proven ability to contribute effectively and drive results.
Experience in using Git for end-to-end deployment in production workloads
Experience working with cloud platforms, such as AWS or GCP
Experience with data orchestration tools, such as Apache Airflow or AWS Step Functions
Proficiency in SQL for data modelling
Experience with data visualisation, and familiarity with self-serve tools such as QuickSight, Looker or Tableau
Familiarity with business metrics such as conversion rates, CAC, CSAT, LTV, MRR and experience working with business teams to define and maintain KPIs
The ability to communicate effectively, simply, and clearly - you can present insights to technical and non-technical audiences, and you love proposing actionable solutions
Self-sufficiency, the ability to motivate yourself and manage your own priorities and time
A passion for bringing fresh ideas to the table, and drive things forward without needing direction
We'd be particularly excited if you have
Experience using DBT (cloud or core) for data modelling in production workflows
Previous experience at a startup or high-growth company in FinTech or Payments
Working knowledge of machine learning methodology and algorithms (including Python packages)
What you can expect from us:
Competitive salary and meaningful equity in the company ðŸ’°
Flexible hours and very flexible hybrid/remote working within Italy
A one-off contribution of â‚¬200 to help you set up your home office ðŸ’º
Flexible holiday policy, with 24 days as standard âœˆï¸
2 volunteering days to support causes important to you ðŸŒ³
Generous parental leave, above and beyond statutory requirements and with no minimum tenure ðŸ‘©â€ðŸ‘©â€ðŸ‘¦

Budget to spend on learning & development each year ðŸ“š
12 fully-paid wellbeing days a year and your birthday off (on top of the holiday allowance) ðŸ•Š
Membership of mental wellbeing platform Spill ðŸ§˜

At TrueLayer, we don't just do inclusion and diversity. We embrace people that have different opinions, perspectives and personalities. Because we believe that by seeing the world from all sorts of angles, we can make life better for all the people who live in it. We strongly encourage applications from underrepresented groups (e.g. people of colour, the LGBTQ+ community, people with disabilities, neurodivergent people, parents, carers, and people from all socio-economic backgrounds). If you'd like to discuss alternative working patterns, please let us know.

We will always aim to make appropriate adjustments to ensure we are fully inclusive to people with different needs during our interview process. So if you need us to make any adjustments to suit your individual needs please let us know - we'll be happy to support you.

Who we are:

At TrueLayer, we're building the future of payments. We're on a mission to take on outdated payment methods with a solution designed for today's online, on-demand economy. By removing friction at the heart of commerce â€” the payment â€” we're making it faster, safer, and smarter for everyone.

To date, we've raised $300 million from world-renowned investors including Stripe, Tiger Global, Addition, and Tencent. With offices in London, Milan, and Dublin, we're trusted by industry leaders like RyanAir and JustEat Takeaway. But this is just the beginning.

We're reimagining how the world pays, invests, shops, and saves. We're transforming payments for industries like e-Commerce and iGaming, redefining what's possible with technology and innovation. Now, we're looking for people who are ready to help us build a brand that changes an industry.

Description

TrueLayer's new Analytics team empowers our entire organisation to make strategic decisions based on a scalable data infrastructure, coupled with commercial insight and impeccable leadership skills.

A Data Analyst at TrueLayer works in cross-functional teams and partners with stakeholders across the company, including Growth, Client Care, Engineering and Product, to unlock the power of data and drive strategic decision-making. You'll spend your time building datasets, conducting analysis and sharing learnings with teams.

In return, we'll empower our Data Analysts to own Analytics planning, and make key decisions around data infrastructure and analytics best practices. Working in an exciting and growing team of Analysts, Data Engineers and an Analytics Lead, your analysis and insight will be the fuel that drives our journey to power the new era of financial innovation globally.

What we expect from you as a Data Analyst:

  • Collaborate with business teams such as Commercial, Product, Client Care, Engineering and Operations to understand and help define their analytics requirements

  • Be a BI subject matter expert, conduct deep analyses and communicate insights to the business

You would have the opportunity to work with a company in the world of fashion luxury retail. Lambitelli is a marketplace and consultant that provides services in tech and marketing for high end fashion companies.
We are looking for a full-time Data Analyst to join our team. This hybrid role, based in Milan, focuses on data transformation, analytics, and creating impactful Power BI dashboards.
Knowledge of programming languages like Python or R is a plus
Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related field is a plus

Company Description

You would have the opportunity to work with a company in the world of fashion luxury retail. Lambitelli is a marketplace and consultant that provides services in tech and marketing for high end fashion companies.


Role Description

We are looking for a full-time Data Analyst to join our team. This hybrid role, based in Milan, focuses on data transformation, analytics, and creating impactful Power BI dashboards.


Qualifications

  • Expertise in Microsoft Power BI
  • Strong data transformation skills
  • Excellent analytical and communication skills
  • Knowledge of programming languages like Python or R is a plus
  • Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related field is a plus

analizzare i dati di vendita e di tanti altri parametri

  • Lavorare con i team artistici, commerciali e di marketing per fornire report, strumenti e analisi ad-hoc che supportino le diverse aree della nostra attivitÃ 
  • Fornire analisi approfondite, identificando strategie e opportunitÃ  commerciali, con un focus su azioni attuabili
  • Formare e supportare i colleghi sugli strumenti e le dashboard di dati
  • Raccogliere feedback e sintetizzare i requisiti per prioritizzare accuratamente le richieste e fornire risultati tempestivi ai team.

Il Tuo Contributo Speciale

  • Hai +5 anni di esperienza come data analyst, con un focus su insight attuabili e analisi creative
  • Ti senti a tuo agio nel creare una narrazione basata sui dati, con visualizzazioni efficaci e indicazioni attuabili
  • Sei esperto/a nell'interpretazione e nell'applicazione di modelli statistici in contesti reali
  • Hai dimostrato forti capacitÃ  analitiche e di problem-solving
column4:
Ã¨ apprezzato un portfolio di lavori rilevanti
  • Sei esperto/a in SQL e ti muovi con sicurezza nei database relazionali
  • Hai esperienza con almeno uno strumento di BI come Tableau, Looker o simili
  • Hai la capacitÃ  di sintetizzare dati provenienti da piÃ¹ fonti
  • Ti piace essere un operatore indipendente, capace di pensiero critico e problem-solving, ma sai come sfruttare le risorse a disposizione per completare il lavoro
  • Sei costantemente curioso riguardo agli insight che si nascondono nei grandi set di dati e sei in grado di comunicarli a un pubblico non tecnico.
  • Hai conoscenza di base di Python e/o R

    • Sarebbe Una Figata Avere

    • Passione per la musica, con una buona conoscenza dell'attuale panorama del consumo musicale
    • Esperienza nel settore musicale

    E invece noi?

    Insieme, siamo Warner Music Group: Musica con Vision e Voce.

    Non scoraggiarti se non ci senti subito. Ci stiamo prendendo il nostro tempo per esaminare tutti i curriculum e trovare le persone migliori per WMG.

    Grazie per il tuo interesse a lavorare per WMGâ¤ï¸. Ci piace tanto stare qui, e pensiamo che piacerÃ  anche a te.

    Le ricerche indicano che spesso le donne non si candidano a una posizione se il loro CV non corrisponde perfettamente ai requisiti. Tuttavia, noi diamo piÃ¹ importanza al talento che all'esperienza. Se il ruolo ti interessa e credi di poter dare il meglio di te con il tempo e un poâ€™ di formazione, non esitare a candidarti.

    WMG Ã¨ impegnata per l'inclusione e la diversitÃ  in tutti gli aspetti del nostro business. Siamo orgogliosi di essere un luogo di lavoro con pari opportunitÃ  e valuteremo i candidati qualificati senza discriminazione di razza, credo religioso, colore, etÃ , sesso, orientamento sessuale, genere, identitÃ  di genere, espressione di genere, origine nazionale, ascendenti, stato civile, condizione medica come definita dalla legge dello stato (caratteristiche genetiche o cancro), disabilitÃ  fisica o mentale, servizio militare o stato di veterano, gravidanza, parto e condizioni mediche correlate, informazioni genetiche o qualsiasi altra caratteristica protetta dalla legge federale, statale o locale applicabile.

LoJack is looking for a candidate for the position of Data Analyst with AI: the role will involve collecting, analyzing, and transforming business data into strategic information to support internal decision-making processes. The individual will be responsible for creating reports and dashboards, as well as managing activities and projects to ensure their effective integration into business processes. Additionally, the role will include performing targeted analyses to address specific business needs.

LoJack Ã¨ alla ricerca di un candidato per la posizione di Data Analyst con competenze di Intelligenza Artificiale: la figura si occuperÃ  di raccogliere, analizzare e trasformare i dati aziendali in informazioni strategiche a supporto dei processi decisionali interni e sarÃ  responsabile della creazione di reportistiche / dashboard e della gestione di attivitÃ  / progetti per una loro efficace integrazione nei processi aziendali, oltre che della realizzazione di analisi mirate per indirizzare specifiche esigenze di business.
Analyze large volumes of data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement.
Develop and implement AI and machine learning models to optimize business decisions and strategies.
Create data flows for the maintenance and enhancement of the DWH.
Create reports and dashboards to visualize data clearly and comprehensively, and monitor business performance.
Maintain and improve data analysis systems and AI infrastructure.
Collaborate with internal teams to translate analysis results into actionable insights and effective strategies.
Analisi di grandi quantitÃ  di dati per identificare tendenze, modelli e opportunitÃ  di miglioramento.
Sviluppo e implementazione di modelli di AI e machine learning per ottimizzare decisioni e strategie aziendali.
Creazione di flussi dati per mantenimento e accrescimento di DWH.
Creazione di report e dashboard per visualizzare i dati in modo chiaro e comprensibile e monitorare le performance aziendali.
Manutenzione e miglioramento dei sistemi di analisi dei dati e lâ€™infrastruttura AI.
Collaborazione con i team interni per tradurre i risultati dell'analisi in azioni pratiche e strategie efficaci.
Technical education: Diploma or degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or other scientific fields (Mathematics, Physics, Statistics).
At least 2 years of previous experience in a similar role.
Advanced knowledge of data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, Power BI, Salesforce reports and dashboards).
Good knowledge of English (knowledge of Spanish and/or French is a plus).
Cross-functional skills such as problem-solving, flexibility, precision, teamwork, analytical abilities, attention to detail, and organization.
Formazione tecnica: diploma o laurea in informatica o Ingegneria o altre materie scientifiche (Matematica, Fisica, Statistica)
Esperienza pregressa di almeno 2 anni in un ruolo simile
Conoscenza avanzata di strumenti di analisi dati (es. SQL, Power BI, report e cruscotti Salesforce)
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese (costituisce un plus la conoscenza della lingua spagnola e/o francese)
Competenze trasversali come problem solving, flessibilitÃ , precisione, team working, capacitÃ  analitiche e orientamento al dettaglio, organizzazione

Overview

LoJack is looking for a candidate for the position of Data Analyst with AI: the role will involve collecting, analyzing, and transforming business data into strategic information to support internal decision-making processes. The individual will be responsible for creating reports and dashboards, as well as managing activities and projects to ensure their effective integration into business processes. Additionally, the role will include performing targeted analyses to address specific business needs.

ResponsabilitÃ

  • Develop and implement AI and machine learning models to optimize business decisions and strategies.
  • Create data flows for the maintenance and enhancement of the DWH.
  • Create reports and dashboards to visualize data clearly and comprehensively, and monitor business performance.

  • Collaborazione con i team interni per tradurre i risultati dell'analisi in azioni pratiche e strategie efficaci.

Titoli di studio

  • Technical education: Diploma or degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or other scientific fields (Mathematics, Physics, Statistics).
  • At least 2 years of previous experience in a similar role.
  • Advanced knowledge of data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, Power BI, Salesforce reports and dashboards).
  • Good knowledge of English (knowledge of Spanish and/or French is a plus).
  • Cross-functional skills such as problem-solving, flexibility, precision, teamwork, analytical abilities, attention to detail, and organization.

Le nostre librerie, fisiche e online, offrono alle lettrici e ai lettori unâ€™esperienza dâ€™acquisto unica, combinando tradizione e innovazione in una serie di servizi integrati. Siamo un punto di riferimento per chiunque voglia immergersi in un universo fatto di storie, cultura e stili di vita. Ma anche di apprendimento: ampia e di qualitÃ  Ã¨ la nostra offerta di editoria scolastica e universitaria.

Lavorare con noi significa contribuire alla continua evoluzione di questo universo. E vuol dire farlo in un ambiente di lavoro costruttivo, in cui il valore della diversitÃ  e dellâ€™inclusione, dellâ€™ascolto e del riconoscimento delle proprie persone Ã¨ assolutamente prioritario. Un ambiente di lavoro animato da forti competenze specifiche, in cui non si smette mai di crescere e imparare. Diffondere il sapere Ã¨ il nostro obiettivo come editore, trasmetterlo internamente Ã¨ lâ€™approccio in cui crediamo come azienda.


Di cosa ti occuperai

Hai una forte passione per il mondo degli audiolibri e una spiccata attitudine allâ€™analisi dei dati? Ti piacerebbe contribuire alla produzione e alla distribuzione di prodotti editoriali in formato audio?

Entrerai come Audiobook Specialist a far parte della unit Digital Sales, allâ€™interno del team dedicato al business degli Audiolibri, e supporterai le seguenti attivitÃ :

4137755973,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-insights-analytics-specialist-at-astrazeneca-4137755973?position=59&pageNum=0&refId=oKn6NLf7YOZDFecaTYm0EA%3D%3D&trackingId=Z%2FWQh3vMbndcuCzNMzInzA%3D%3D,Business Insights & Analytics Specialist,AstraZeneca,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","As a Business Insights & Analytics Specialist, reporting to the Business Insight & Analytics Head within AstraZeneca Oncology Business Unit, you will act as the reference point for the cross-functional team within the therapeutic area, managing all activities related to business insights and analytics. Your mission will be to critically interpret data and transform it into strategic business recommendations that drive decision-making, fostering a data-driven culture.

This role requires a deep understanding of customer insights and advanced business analytics. You will play a pivotal role in ensuring that all strategic initiatives are guided by robust data analysis and interpretation, enabling AstraZeneca to anticipate market trends and meet evolving business needs.
As a Business Insights & Analytics Specialist, you will be responsible for:

Serve as the primary point of reference for all market research and customer insights activities within the therapeutic area, transforming complex data into strategic insights that will inform and guide business decision

Collaborate with the cross-functional team as well as external vendors to design projects that address business needs, supporting both current and future portfolio, while keeping in mind the evolution of the healthcare context in which we operate through horizon scanning activities

Develop medium and long-term strategic forecasts for AZ Oncology marketed products and pipeline that incorporate disease epidemiology, evolving treatment paradigms, competitive products, pricing and access dynamics - collaborating closely with the cross-functional team and Finance Dept - ensuring that forecast models are informed by the latest data available
Lead performance monitoring to help internal stakeholders stay informed by providing strategic insights for the business
Strategic data generation, analysis and reporting:

Collect data and information related to AZ Oncology products and competitors to support business growth as well as transform data and insights into business recommendations, communicating them to various stakeholders at different levels
Develop expertise in the analysis and interpretation of diverse data sets, converting them into actionable reports, dashboards and tools, to enable effective decision-making across the organization

Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and global/regional I&A teams to evaluate market opportunities thorough data assessment (ie. competitive landscape, market potential, HCP insights etc) to advise and support strategic plans
You will manage all activities and relationships in accordance with company values, code of conduct, internal procedures, and Italian legislation.
3-4 years of experience in Business Intelligence or Business Insights or Market Analysis or Finance
Experience in a Healthcare Company or market research industry or Healthcare Consultancy
Experience in a Healthcare Company or market research industry or Healthcare Consultancy
Proven analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Strong influencing skills to provide guidance to peers and seniors
Proficiency in written and spoken English

Salary range: â‚¬50-80,000 plus access to equity in Eight Sleep

Eight Sleep is the worldâ€™s first sleep fitness company. Our mission is to fuel human potential through optimal sleep. We use innovative technology, detailed design, and proven science and data to personalize and improve each night for everybodyâ€”changing the way people sleep forever and for the better.

With our flagship product, the Pod, we are addressing critical sleep issues such as temperature regulation, bed elevation, snoring reduction, and the wake-up experience. Hundreds of thousands of customers around the world sleep better every night thanks to the Pod.

But weâ€™re just getting started. Weâ€™re committed to developing more groundbreaking products to tackle additional sleep problems, changing the role sleep plays in our lives forever. Weâ€™re excited about the journey ahead and the impact we can make as we continue to innovate and expand our offerings to fulfill our mission.

We are backed by leading Silicon Valley investors like YC Combinator, Founders Fund, Valor, and Khosla Ventures, and we have been recognized as one of Fast Companyâ€™s Most Innovative Companies in 2018, 2022, and 2023.The Pod was also recognized two years in a row by TIME's â€œBest Inventions of the Year.â€ We currently sell the Pod in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, Europe, and Australia.

Eight Sleep is an intense environment: weâ€™re demanding and ambitious, which means we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. This means fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, but it also requires a significant commitment. Our dedication, drive, and intensity rivals those of Olympic athletes. At Eight Sleep, we have Kobe Bryantâ€™s mamba mentality - we always aim to be at the best 1% of what we do. If youâ€™re looking for a 9-5, this is not for you. If you want to be challenged and pushed harder than ever before, we invite you to apply.

Weâ€™re seeking a data-driven and detail-oriented detail-oriented Data Analytics Expert (an individual contributor) to join our Data & Analytics team within the Growth organization. The ideal candidate has a proven track record delivering insights that influence the product and marketing roadmaps. This role will use sales, marketing and ecommerce data to build reporting, dashboards and KPIs and extract findings from complex analyses.
Analyze marketing and ecommerce data sets to identify trends and unique insights that optimize the Performance Marketing and Web programs
Design and analyze lift-based/incrementality experiments across Performance Marketing channels (Facebook, Search, YouTube, OTT, etc.)
Create and maintain dashboards and visualizations using Looker and other tools to provide key insights to the Growth team
Build statistical models that produce revenue projections and ad spend allocation
Assist in managing our data warehouse
column2: building and maintaining data pipelines, data models and automating workflows

column1: Utilize data to deepen Eight Sleepâ€™s understanding of user acquisition and improve performance at the portfolio and channel level

Experience as a Data Analyst, Data Scientist, Analytics Engineer or similar technical role
B.S. degree in Business, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or other quantitative field preferred
Expert-level knowledge of SQL, experience using Python or R is a plus
Advanced knowledge of end-to-end data infrastructure, including using data pipeline tools, data transformation tools such as DBT and data warehousing best practices
Expert knowledge of business intelligence tools such as Looker, Tableau, and Google Sheets/Excel
A data-driven approach to performance marketing and experience utilizing large data sets to inform strategic decision making
Highly effective written and verbal communication skills
Ability to translate complex findings into actionable insights
Be an Independent self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment and is comfortable owning a high level of responsibility
Innovation in a culture of excellence

Join us in a workplace where innovation isnâ€™t just encouraged - itâ€™s a standard. Our flagship product, the Pod, is a testament to our culture of excellence, beloved by hundreds of thousands of customers worldwide. At Eight Sleep, you will be part of a team that continuously pushes the boundaries of technology in sleep fitness.
Immediate responsibility and accelerated career growth

From your first day, youâ€™ll take on substantial responsibilities that have a direct impact on our core business and product success. We are a small team that empowers you to own your projects and see the tangible effects of your efforts, enhancing both your professional growth and our companyâ€™s trajectory. Your path will be challenging but rewarding, perfect for those who thrive in fast-paced environments aiming for high standards.

Work alongside other bright minds like you: at Eight Sleep exceptional intelligence and a passion for breakthroughs are the norms. Our team members are not only experts in their fields but also avid innovators who thrive in our dynamic, fast-paced environment.
Equitable Compensation And Continuous Equity Investment

We extend equity participation to every full-time team member, recognizing and rewarding your direct contributions to our success. This includes periodic equity refreshments based on performance, ensuring that as Eight Sleep grows and succeeds, so do you â€“ perfectly aligning your achievements with the broader triumphs of the company. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience within the Company and translate it into concrete impact.
Your Own Pod - And Other Great Benefits

Every Eight Sleep employee receives the very product that defines our mission: a Pod of their own. If you join us youâ€™ll get your own Pod, along with flexible PTO, paid parental leave and other benefits.

At Eight Sleep we continually celebrate the diverse community different individuals cultivate. As an equal opportunity employer, we stay true to our values by ensuring everyone feels they can flourish and grow. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

At TrueLayer, we're building the future of payments. We're on a mission to take on outdated payment methods with a solution designed for today's online, on-demand economy. By removing friction at the heart of commerce â€” the payment â€” we're making it faster, safer, and smarter for everyone.

To date, we've raised $300 million from world-renowned investors including Stripe, Tiger Global, Addition, and Tencent. With offices in London, Milan, and Dublin, we're trusted by industry leaders like RyanAir and JustEat Takeaway. But this is just the beginning.

We're reimagining how the world pays, invests, shops, and saves. We're transforming payments for industries like e-Commerce and iGaming, redefining what's possible with technology and innovation. Now, we're looking for people who are ready to help us build a brand that changes an industry.
TrueLayer's new Analytics team empowers our entire organisation to make strategic decisions based on a scalable data infrastructure, coupled with commercial insight and impeccable leadership skills.

A Data Analyst at TrueLayer works in cross-functional teams and partners with stakeholders across the company, including Growth, Client Care, Engineering and Product, to unlock the power of data and drive strategic decision-making. You'll spend your time building datasets, conducting analysis and sharing learnings with teams.

In return, we'll empower our Data Analysts to own Analytics planning, and make key decisions around data infrastructure and analytics best practices. Working in an exciting and growing team of Analysts, Data Engineers and an Analytics Lead, your analysis and insight will be the fuel that drives our journey to power the new era of financial innovation globally.
What we expect from you as a Data Analyst:
Collaborate with business teams such as Commercial, Product, Client Care, Engineering and Operations to understand and help define their analytics requirements
Build and maintain data models for key business use cases, through DBT
Drive the collection and integration of new and existing data sources
Be a BI subject matter expert, conduct deep analyses and communicate insights to the business
Help cultivate a data-driven culture by providing TrueLayeristas with the knowledge and tools required to self-serve
Relevant experience that aligns with the key requirements of the role, demonstrating a proven ability to contribute effectively and drive results.
Experience in using Git for end-to-end deployment in production workloads
Experience working with cloud platforms, such as AWS or GCP
Experience with data orchestration tools, such as Apache Airflow or AWS Step Functions
Proficiency in SQL for data modelling
Experience with data visualisation, and familiarity with self-serve tools such as QuickSight, Looker or Tableau
Familiarity with business metrics such as conversion rates, CAC, CSAT, LTV, MRR and experience working with business teams to define and maintain KPIs
The ability to communicate effectively, simply, and clearly - you can present insights to technical and non-technical audiences, and you love proposing actionable solutions
Self-sufficiency, the ability to motivate yourself and manage your own priorities and time
A passion for bringing fresh ideas to the table, and drive things forward without needing direction
We'd be particularly excited if you have
Experience using DBT (cloud or core) for data modelling in production workflows
Previous experience at a startup or high-growth company in FinTech or Payments
Working knowledge of machine learning methodology and algorithms (including Python packages)
What you can expect from us:
Competitive salary and meaningful equity in the company ðŸ’°
Flexible hours and very flexible hybrid/remote working within Italy
A one-off contribution of â‚¬200 to help you set up your home office ðŸ’º
Flexible holiday policy, with 24 days as standard âœˆï¸
2 volunteering days to support causes important to you ðŸŒ³
Generous parental leave, above and beyond statutory requirements and with no minimum tenure ðŸ‘©â€ðŸ‘©â€ðŸ‘¦
Meal vouchers for every day you're working, including while remote [IT Roles Only]
Budget to spend on learning & development each year ðŸ“š
12 fully-paid wellbeing days a year and your birthday off (on top of the holiday allowance) ðŸ•Š
Membership of mental wellbeing platform Spill ðŸ§˜

At TrueLayer, we don't just do inclusion and diversity. We embrace people that have different opinions, perspectives and personalities. Because we believe that by seeing the world from all sorts of angles, we can make life better for all the people who live in it. We strongly encourage applications from underrepresented groups (e.g. people of colour, the LGBTQ+ community, people with disabilities, neurodivergent people, parents, carers, and people from all socio-economic backgrounds). If you'd like to discuss alternative working patterns, please let us know.

We will always aim to make appropriate adjustments to ensure we are fully inclusive to people with different needs during our interview process. So if you need us to make any adjustments to suit your individual needs please let us know - we'll be happy to support you.

Who we are:

At TrueLayer, we're building the future of payments. We're on a mission to take on outdated payment methods with a solution designed for today's online, on-demand economy. By removing friction at the heart of commerce â€” the payment â€” we're making it faster, safer, and smarter for everyone.

To date, we've raised $300 million from world-renowned investors including Stripe, Tiger Global, Addition, and Tencent. With offices in London, Milan, and Dublin, we're trusted by industry leaders like RyanAir and JustEat Takeaway. But this is just the beginning.

We're reimagining how the world pays, invests, shops, and saves. We're transforming payments for industries like e-Commerce and iGaming, redefining what's possible with technology and innovation. Now, we're looking for people who are ready to help us build a brand that changes an industry.

A Data Analyst at TrueLayer works in cross-functional teams and partners with stakeholders across the company, including Growth, Client Care, Engineering and Product, to unlock the power of data and drive strategic decision-making. In return, we'll empower our Data Analysts to own Analytics planning, and make key decisions around data infrastructure and analytics best practices. Working in an exciting and growing team of Analysts, Data Engineers and an Analytics Lead, your analysis and insight will be the fuel that drives our journey to power the new era of financial innovation globally.

KONE is an innovative leader in the elevator and escalator industry. Our job is to improve the flow of urban life in a sustainable way. We do this by providing innovative solutions and services for our customers around the world.

We are recruiting a talented Data Analyst to join our dynamic team and help us maintain the highest standards of data quality and integrity. The person will be part of the team dedicated to the ""FIELD SERVICE MANAGEMENT"" - FSM: a major program that will enable the transition to the new Service system in the company.

Position Overview: As a Data Analyst at KONE, you will play a crucial role in the FSM project . You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to analyze and implement data management processes, maintain data governance standards, and troubleshoot data-related issues.
Tasks to be performed (an adequate training will be provided):
Understand and study process flows of business environment, participate to relevant workshops intended to design the to be Service configuration
Work in team with Italy&Iberica, Europe and KCO to define criteria Master Data fields must comply with, involving the FLâ€™s relevant business stakeholders
Cooperate with colleagues of different business functions to analyze and define what data are to be changed and what can be taken as they are
Extract data from SAP master data in various business workstreams and check if they are compliant with KONE requirements, involving the FLâ€™s relevant business stakeholders
Lead the correction/cleansing of data which are not in compliance in cooperation with colleagues and provide the correct data to the colleagues who will upload them into SAP system
Work in team with all other colleagues of the working team to ensure a smooth deployment of the new FSM tool, providing training and assistance to end users where required.
May conduct end-user training for the data management and related tools to ensure adoption and understanding of global data management processes.
Acts as the first level support for the data (i.e. customers

KONE is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

At KONE, we are focused on creating an innovative and collaborative working culture where we value the contribution of each individual. Employee engagement is a key focus area for us and we encourage participation and the sharing of information and ideas. Sustainability is an integral part of our culture and the daily practice. We follow ethical business practices and we seek to develop a culture of working together where co-workers trust and respect each other and good performance is recognized. In being a great place to work, we are proud to offer a range of experiences and opportunities that will help you to achieve your career and personal goals and enable you to live a healthy and balanced life.

4137755973,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-insights-analytics-specialist-at-astrazeneca-4137755973?position=7&pageNum=2&refId=Sy9xlvEzNs8nZS%2FgTsAqUQ%3D%3D&trackingId=igjAgsyyj6w93A0B5L9XaA%3D%3D,Business Insights & Analytics Specialist,AstraZeneca,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","As a Business Insights & Analytics Specialist, reporting to the Business Insight & Analytics Head within AstraZeneca Oncology Business Unit, you will act as the reference point for the cross-functional team within the therapeutic area, managing all activities related to business insights and analytics. Your mission will be to critically interpret data and transform it into strategic business recommendations that drive decision-making, fostering a data-driven culture.

This role requires a deep understanding of customer insights and advanced business analytics. You will play a pivotal role in ensuring that all strategic initiatives are guided by robust data analysis and interpretation, enabling AstraZeneca to anticipate market trends and meet evolving business needs.
As a Business Insights & Analytics Specialist, you will be responsible for:

Serve as the primary point of reference for all market research and customer insights activities within the therapeutic area, transforming complex data into strategic insights that will inform and guide business decision

Collaborate with the cross-functional team as well as external vendors to design projects that address business needs, supporting both current and future portfolio, while keeping in mind the evolution of the healthcare context in which we operate through horizon scanning activities

Develop medium and long-term strategic forecasts for AZ Oncology marketed products and pipeline that incorporate disease epidemiology, evolving treatment paradigms, competitive products, pricing and access dynamics - collaborating closely with the cross-functional team and Finance Dept - ensuring that forecast models are informed by the latest data available
Lead performance monitoring to help internal stakeholders stay informed by providing strategic insights for the business
Strategic data generation, analysis and reporting:

Collect data and information related to AZ Oncology products and competitors to support business growth as well as transform data and insights into business recommendations, communicating them to various stakeholders at different levels
Develop expertise in the analysis and interpretation of diverse data sets, converting them into actionable reports, dashboards and tools, to enable effective decision-making across the organization

Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and global/regional I&A teams to evaluate market opportunities thorough data assessment (ie. competitive landscape, market potential, HCP insights etc) to advise and support strategic plans
You will manage all activities and relationships in accordance with company values, code of conduct, internal procedures, and Italian legislation.
3-4 years of experience in Business Intelligence or Business Insights or Market Analysis or Finance
Experience in a Healthcare Company or market research industry or Healthcare Consultancy
Experience in a Healthcare Company or market research industry or Healthcare Consultancy
Proven analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Strong influencing skills to provide guidance to peers and seniors
Proficiency in written and spoken English

Nati nel 2003, abbiamo raccolto e valorizzato lâ€™esperienza storica della consulenza e abbiamo aggiunto due ingredienti chiave: lâ€™innovazione e la digitalizzazione.

Grazie a questo percorso siamo oggi oltre 5000 professionisti e professioniste, presenti in 13 Paesi, con oltre 4500 progetti alle spalle e le conoscenze piÃ¹ allâ€™avanguardia nell'ambito della Digital Transformation, Data Science, Cybersecurity, Industry 4.0, IOT e di tutte le Disruptive Technologies che mettiamo a servizio di ogni settore di mercato.
Aiutiamo i nostri clienti a fare la differenza creando qualitÃ  su larga scala attraverso una formula che opera su tre leve: Valore, Persone e Tecnologia.

Crediamo nel valore dellâ€™eccellenza, che Ã¨ la bussola su cui orientiamo il nostro agire, e adottiamo un approccio etico e leale nei confronti di quante e quanti scelgono di lavorare con noi, promuovendo un ambiente in cui le persone possano crescere insieme, grazie alla contaminazione tra competenze diverse.
Entra a far parte di BIP xTech, il Centro di Eccellenza di BIP specializzato in consulenzaÂ e servizi innovativi in ambito Data Analytics, Big Data, Data Science, RPA, Cloud, Blockchain e Networking.

In particolare, verrai considerato per far parte di DANA, il Competence Team di xTech che accoglie i nostri consulenti Data Analyst â€“ figure professionali che combinano competenze informatiche e statistiche con lâ€™interesse per il business e i processi operativi dei nostri clienti. Il team segue progetti di lungo, medio e breve termine, con attivitÃ  quali:
Estrazione, pulizia, modellazione e analisi dati, con strumenti tipici del settore (quali MS Excel, SQL, SAS e Python)
Costruzione di modelli analitici e di reportistica interattiva con MS Excel
Automazione di processi operativi tramite modelli MS Excel avanzati, macro VBA, ed eventuali altre tecnologie a supporto

Supporto allâ€™operativitÃ  dei clienti nellâ€™esecuzione dei processi, utilizzando le proprie competenze tecniche specifiche per individuare ed implementare soluzioni di efficientamento, anche in collaborazione con colleghi xTech con altre specializzazioni
Analisi funzionali in ambito dati e IT
Project management in ambito dati e IT.
Le posizioni aperte riguardano profili sia junior che senior.

Ti sarÃ  richiesto, in modo commisurato alla tua seniority, di dimostrare ed evolvere le capacitÃ  di costruire relazioni con clienti, vendor e partner, promuovendo il raggiungimento degli obbiettivi aziendali.
Sarai tu a entrare nel nostro team?

Laurea Specialistica in Ingegneria Gestionale, Ingegneria Informatica, Ingegneria Matematica, Ingegneria delle Telecomunicazioni, Informatica, Statistica, Marketing, Economia, Management, Scienze Politiche o altre discipline con metodi quantitativi
Ottima competenza con MS Excel, pivot e formule
Ottima competenza con il linguaggio SQL

Buona attitudine e flessibilitÃ  a lavorare sia in team sia in autonomia
Precisione e stress tolerance nel rispetto delle scadenze
DisponibilitÃ  per trasferte in Italia e allâ€™estero
People at the center of our culture
Fiducia e collaborazione, imprenditorialitÃ  e coraggio, meritocrazia e sviluppo guidano la crescita delle nostre persone.
Lavorare in BIP Ã¨ un'esperienza sfidante, in cui il merito paga e l'innovazione avviene attraverso idee coraggiose, collaborazione e un rapporto di fiducia con i nostri clienti.Â

Avrai la possibilitÃ  di metterti alla prova in contesti progettuali diversi in termini di ambito, natura delle attivitÃ  e stakeholders coinvolti. Vedrai valorizzato il tuo spirito di iniziativa, la tua passione, lâ€™autonomia e la capacitÃ  di assumerti responsabilitÃ  e metterti in gioco.
Potrai partecipare a + di 300 corsi formativi allâ€™avanguardia per accrescere le tue competenze su tecnologie e temi di business emergenti.
Troverai una policy che supportaÂ lo smartworkingÂ fino al 100% del proprio tempo e favorisce il work-life integration.
Valorizziamo lâ€™unicitÃ  e ci impegniamo a garantire che tutti abbiano pari opportunitÃ  di dare un contributo ed esprimere al massimo il potenziale nell'ambiente di lavoro.

Il nostro approccio alla diversitÃ  e allâ€™inclusione si fonda sui principi di etica e integritÃ  e rappresenta il fattore determinante per lo sviluppo di orizzonti, di crescita personale e aziendale, piÃ¹ ampi.
Promuoviamo lâ€™inserimento e lâ€™integrazione lavorativa delle persone appartenenti alle categorie protette â€“ in base a quanto disciplinato dalla legge 68/99 â€“.
Una volta ricevuto il tuo cv ci prenderemo del tempo per valutarlo attentamente.
Se câ€™Ã¨ un match con questa o con altre posizioni aperte allâ€™interno del Gruppo, ti contatteremo per iniziare la nostra conoscenza reciproca.
Lâ€™iter di selezione comprende generalmente un colloquio con HR, un colloquio tecnico con un line manager ed un eventuale colloquio con un Partner.
Lâ€™ordine e il numero delle interviste potrebbero variare a seconda delle esigenze di recruiting.
In alternativa, saremo felici di conservare il tuo CV nel nostro database
per poterlo rivalutare per altre opportunitÃ  future.
Se dovessi identificare ulteriori posizioni di tuo interesse ed in linea con il tuo profilo, aspettiamo la tua candidatura per poterla valutare nuovamente.

Siamo la maggiore realtÃ  editoriale italiana. I libri sono la nostra storia e il nostro futuro, i prodotti digitali la nuova frontiera dei nostri magazine e brand. Le nostre librerie, fisiche e online, offrono alle lettrici e ai lettori unâ€™esperienza dâ€™acquisto unica, combinando tradizione e innovazione in una serie di servizi integrati. Siamo un punto di riferimento per chiunque voglia immergersi in un universo fatto di storie, cultura e stili di vita. Ma anche di apprendimento: ampia e di qualitÃ  Ã¨ la nostra offerta di editoria scolastica e universitaria.

Lavorare con noi significa contribuire alla continua evoluzione di questo universo. E vuol dire farlo in un ambiente di lavoro costruttivo, in cui il valore della diversitÃ  e dellâ€™inclusione, dellâ€™ascolto e del riconoscimento delle proprie persone Ã¨ assolutamente prioritario. Un ambiente di lavoro animato da forti competenze specifiche, in cui non si smette mai di crescere e imparare. Diffondere il sapere Ã¨ il nostro obiettivo come editore, trasmetterlo internamente Ã¨ lâ€™approccio in cui crediamo come azienda.

Hai una forte passione per il mondo degli audiolibri e una spiccata attitudine allâ€™analisi dei dati? Ti piacerebbe contribuire alla produzione e alla distribuzione di prodotti editoriali in formato audio?
Entrerai come Audiobook Specialist a far parte della unit Digital Sales, allâ€™interno del team dedicato al business degli Audiolibri, e supporterai le seguenti attivitÃ :
Analisi di mercato e concorrenza: analizzerai i trend di mercato e la concorrenza, con lâ€™obiettivo di fornire report utili per la definizione e gestione del piano editoriale
Analisi dati: effettuerai analisi qualitative e quantitative sui dati di ascolto e ricavi, con lâ€™obiettivo di ottimizzare il fatturato e massimizzare le opportunitÃ  di crescita
Previsioni e budget: creerai modelli previsionali e parteciperai alla definizione realizzazione del budget
Lancio del prodotto: supporterai il lancio dei prodotti sul mercato tramite le piattaforme di distribuzione Audio
Gestione della produzione degli audiolibri: collaborerai con editori, agenti e studi di registrazione per il processo di produzione, dalla selezione delle voci alla realizzazione finale del prodotto.

Ami i libri in tutte le loro forme e il mondo dellâ€™audio ti affascina particolarmente. Ti interessa lavorare in un contesto dinamico, in cui coniugare capacitÃ  analitiche, creativitÃ  e attenzione ai dettagli.
esperienza di circa 2 anni in ruoli simili, preferibilmente in ambito editoriale o nei settori dellâ€™intrattenimento digitale
laurea in Economia, Marketing o discipline affini
competenze analitiche e dimestichezza con i dati di vendita e di mercato
ottima conoscenza di Excel e di strumenti di analisi dati
attitudine al problem solving, capacitÃ  organizzative e attenzione ai dettagli.
PossibilitÃ  di smartworking, accesso alla mensa aziendale nei giorni di presenza in sede, accesso al welfare e a tutti i servizi aziendali.
Sede di lavoro: Segrate (MI), ben collegata con il servizio di navetta aziendale e con le linee del servizio pubblico consultabili sul nostro sito (https://www.mondadori.it/come-raggiungerci)
Se ti riconosci in questo annuncio e hai voglia di unirti a noi, inviaci la tua candidatura!

Siamo felici di ricevere candidature da profili diversi per genere, etÃ  e cultura, perchÃ© crediamo nelle pari opportunitÃ , ma ancor piÃ¹ nel valore aggiunto che ogni individuo, con la propria unicitÃ , puÃ² apportare al nostro Gruppo.
