Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn and save by reshaping their relationship with money. Over 5,000,000 active users choose Tabby to stay in control of their spending and make the most out of their money.

Over 30,000 global brands and small businesses, including Amazon, H&M, Adidas, IKEA, SHEIN, noon, and Bloomingdaleâ€™s use Tabbyâ€™s technology to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering flexible payments online and in stores. Tabby is active in Saudi Arabia, UAE, Egypt and Kuwait and backed by leading investors, including Sequoia Capital India, STV, PayPal Ventures, Mubadala Investment Capital, Arbor Ventures and others.

We are looking for a Marketing Analyst to contribute to the evolution of Tabby. Marketing Analyst will work with our marketing team and help us evaluate marketing efficiency and find the best way to acquire new and reactivate existing users, playing a pivotal role in launching and optimizing marketing strategies that drive meaningful impact. You'll collaborate closely with Analysts, Marketing, and Product teams.
Youâ€™ll be working in a dynamic, rapidly evolving environment with the following responsibilities:

Provide analytical support to the Marketing and Product Marketing teams across all facets of their work, including evaluation of customer. acquisition cost, customer spending forecast, and finding an optimal mix of marketing channels.
Generate hypotheses, conduct research and A/B tests, and present your findings clearly and compellingly to highlight the importance of your insights.
Support and monitor existing performance marketing metrics, identify areas for improvement, and develop new metrics that inform decision-making across the organization.
Develop data visualizations and reports that are informative and easily understood by business and product teams.
Assist in the planning of necessary data structures.
3+ years of experience as a data/marketing analyst.
Proficiency in SQL and relational databases.
Proficiency in data visualization tools, particularly Tableau.
Proficiency in digital marketing platforms from Meta and Google.
Strong understanding of mobile attribution and MMPs (AppsFlyer, Adjust, etc.), including event tracking, postbacks, and troubleshooting.
Experience working with SKAdNetwork (SKAN) data â€” extracting, decoding, and analyzing postbacks to optimize iOS campaigns.
Knowledge of privacy-first attribution frameworks like Appleâ€™s ATT, Meta's AEM, and Googleâ€™s Privacy Sandbox.
Experience with marketing attribution platforms is a plus.
Knowledge of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Statsmodels, Matplotlib, etc.) is a plus.
Experience in designing and conducting A/B tests is a plus.
Strong quantitative skills and a structured approach to problem-solving. Ability to analyze issues, identify root causes, and recommend solutions.
We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
Participation in companyâ€™s employee stock options program.
We offer remote work from anywhere in the world and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.
Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration: at the moment those are Armenia/Georgia/Serbia/Portugal/Spain.
We will help you open a legal entity and a bank account. In Armenia and Georgia the taxes are compensated by Tabby. In other countries we provide partial compensation of taxes.
We employ according to B2B contracts (service agreements).
For our employees we cover the following:
Flight to one of the mentioned countries.
Accommodation during the paperwork completion period.
Opening a bank account and getting a residence permit in one of the mentioned countries.

New employees can also choose an alternative method of relocation to another country of their choice. In this case, Tabby will reimburse up to $5,000 of verified costs upon opening a legal entity and a bank account.
We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow and meet their goals (whatever they may be).
If this sounds exciting to you, weâ€™d love to hear from you!

Department: Product

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote/Milan

Description

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn and save by reshaping their relationship with money. Over 5,000,000 active users choose Tabby to stay in control of their spending and make the most out of their money.

Over 30,000 global brands and small businesses, including Amazon, H&
column2:
M, Adidas, IKEA, SHEIN, noon, and Bloomingdaleâ€™s use Tabbyâ€™s technology to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering flexible payments online and in stores. Tabby is active in Saudi Arabia, UAE, Egypt and Kuwait and backed by leading investors, including Sequoia Capital India, STV, PayPal Ventures, Mubadala Investment Capital, Arbor Ventures and others.

We are looking for a Marketing Analyst to contribute to the evolution of Tabby. Marketing Analyst will work with our marketing team and help us evaluate marketing efficiency and find the best way to acquire new and reactivate existing users, playing a pivotal role in launching and optimizing marketing strategies that drive meaningful impact. You'll collaborate closely with Analysts, Marketing, and Product teams.

Youâ€™ll be working in a dynamic, rapidly evolving environment with the following responsibilities:

  • Provide analytical support to the Marketing and Product Marketing teams across all facets of their work, including evaluation of customer. acquisition cost, customer spending forecast, and finding an optimal mix of marketing channels.
  • Generate hypotheses, conduct research and A/B tests, and present your findings clearly and compellingly to highlight the importance of your insights.
  • Support and monitor existing performance marketing metrics, identify areas for improvement, and develop new metrics that inform decision-making across the organization.
  • Develop data visualizations and reports that are informative and easily understood by business and product teams.
  • Assist in the planning of necessary data structures.


Skills, Knowledge &
column3:
Expertise:

  • 3+ years of experience as a data/marketing analyst.
  • Proficiency in SQL and relational databases.
  • Proficiency in data visualization tools, particularly Tableau.
  • Proficiency in digital marketing platforms from Meta and Google.
  • Strong understanding of mobile attribution and MMPs (AppsFlyer, Adjust, etc.), including event tracking, postbacks, and troubleshooting.
  • Experience working with SKAdNetwork (SKAN) data â€” extracting, decoding, and analyzing postbacks to optimize iOS campaigns.
  • Knowledge of privacy-first attribution frameworks like Appleâ€™s ATT, Meta's AEM, and Googleâ€™s Privacy Sandbox.
  • Experience with marketing attribution platforms is a plus.
  • Knowledge of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Statsmodels, Matplotlib, etc.) is a plus.
  • Experience in designing and conducting A/B tests is a plus.
  • Strong quantitative skills and a structured approach to problem-solving. Ability to analyze issues, identify root causes, and recommend solutions.
  • Fluency in English.


Job Benefits:

  • We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
  • A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
  • You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
  • Participation in companyâ€™s employee stock options program.
  • Health Insurance.


Relocation

We offer remote work from anywhere in the world and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.

Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration: at the moment those are Armenia/Georgia/Serbia/Portugal/Spain.

We will help you open a legal entity and a bank account. In Armenia and Georgia the taxes are compensated by Tabby. In other countries we provide partial compensation of taxes.

We employ according to B2B contracts (service agreements).

For our employees we cover the following:

  • Flight to one of the mentioned countries.
  • Accommodation during the paperwork completion period.
  • Opening a bank account and getting a residence permit in one of the mentioned countries.
  • Family relocation (dependants).


New employees can also choose an alternative method of relocation to another country of their choice. In this case, Tabby will reimburse up to $5,000 of verified costs upon opening a legal entity and a bank account.

We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow and meet their goals (whatever they may be).

If this sounds exciting to you, weâ€™d love to hear from you!

4126012609,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analyst-%E2%80%93-real-estate-valuation-data-solutions-at-savills-italy-4126012609?position=2&pageNum=7&refId=VMfDrXWIEibzONKoULltkA%3D%3D&trackingId=cs14AxUHJIzewznMm99uqw%3D%3D,Analyst â€“ Real Estate Valuation & Data Solutions,Savills Italy,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Who we are looking for?

We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Real Estate Valuation Analyst to join our valuation team. The ideal candidate will leverage expertise in financial modelling, data analysis, and programming to support and enhance our in-house valuation processes.

This role is pivotal in streamlining workflows, providing data-driven insights, and ensuring efficiency and accuracy in the valuation of real estate assets and portfolios. The successful candidate will collaborate closely with local valuation experts and benefit from the support of our pan-European valuation data and technology network.
The ideal joiner is a strong team player with excellent communication skills and:
Advanced analytical capabilities, both quantitative and qualitative
High attention to detail and ability to manage complex tasks
Fluent in Italian and English (both written and spoken)
Proficient in Microsoft Excel and expert in financial modelling, data cleaning, and analysis
Knowledge of a scripting language, preferably VBA or Python
Experience in handling large datasets and working with structured data systems.
Do you think you have what it takes to become part of Savills Valuation Team? Read further and apply here >>
What you will be responsible for?
Maintain, enhance, and develop solutions for real estate valuation processes and tools
Ensure consistent and accurate data exchange between applications and databases
Structure, clean, and import client data to ensure readiness for analysis and modelling
Act as the central contact for data management, analysis, and workflow improvement queries
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement new tools and improve operational efficiency.
What other skills are essential to fulfil this role 100%?
Educational background in Economics, Information Technology, Engineer, Architecture or related fields
Previous experience in finance, real estate, or data analytics
Familiarity with database design and administration (e.g., SQL)
Experience using business intelligence tools like Power BI or Tableau
Knowledge of valuation methodologies, in particular the discounted cash flow (DCF) approach.
Growing in a professional, inclusive and supportive work-environment
Experiencing a company culture that rewards high performance and nurtures talent
Interesting compensation pack with potential yearly bonus which reflects performance and goals achievement as team member
Savills is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin or disability status.
Personal data will be processed for the applications screening. For further details please refer to our Privacy Policy on our website https://www.savills.it/footer/Informativa-sulla-privacy.aspx.

This role is pivotal in streamlining workflows, providing data-driven insights, and ensuring efficiency and accuracy in the valuation of real estate assets and portfolios. The successful candidate will collaborate closely with local valuation experts and benefit from the support of our pan-European valuation data and technology network.


The ideal joiner is a strong team player with excellent communication skills and:

  • 1/2 year experience in similar role

We are looking for a skilled and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join our dynamic and solution-oriented team. In this role, you will be the crucial link between the business and operational services, supporting key departments such as sales, claims, underwriting, and product development. Variety will be your daily reality, with opportunities to contribute across diverse areas like implementing AI solutions, supporting pricing strategies, and providing actionable insights.


What Will You Do?

You will:

  • Support the business by answering complex quantitative questions and delivering clear, actionable insights.
  • Monitor and analyze product portfolios to identify trends and improvement opportunities.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to support product development and pricing exercises.
  • Provide data-driven recommendations to enhance performance across departments.
  • Coach and train colleagues to strengthen their analytical capabilities.


Your Strengths

Weâ€™re looking for someone who:

  • Is fluent in English and has a strong knowledge of Dutch or French, with a good understanding of the other language.
  • Knowledge of Qlik or similar data visualization tools.
  • Has advanced expertise in Microsoft Excel, with little left to learn in the tool.
  • Holds a degree in fields like Business Administration, Business Economics, Business Engineering, or an equivalent qualification through experience.
  • Has a passion for numbers and the ability to explain complex analyses to non-experts.
  • Tackles challenges proactively and learns from every experience.
  • Combines pragmatism, openness to feedback, and a critical yet positive mindset.
  • Can work independently but thrives in a team-oriented, self-steered environment.


Nice-to-Haves

  • Experience in insurance.
  • An interest in AI, machine learning, or advanced analytics techniques.


What We Offer

  • A varied and dynamic role within a supportive team.
  • A modern workspace with flexible working arrangements, including remote work options.
  • A full-time, permanent contract with competitive compensation and fringe benefits.
  • Additional vacation days to maintain a healthy work-life balance.
  • Opportunities for continuous learning and personal development.


If youâ€™re ready to take initiative, contribute to impactful projects, and join a team that values collaboration and innovation, weâ€™re eager to meet you. Apply now and be part of a company where your well-being and professional growth are top priorities.

Our consulting client is looking for a Data Analyst to join the team in Brussels.


Experience in the Insurance industry is mandatory.


The candidate will analyse and interpret large volumes of data and evaluate results to provide insights that assist decision-making.


During system implementation projects, they conduct source-to-target data mapping activities by thoroughly examining entities, products, and processes to ensure coherent mapping.


Responsibilities:


  • Data Collection and Processing
  • Data Analysis
  • Data Visualization
  • Reporting and Presentation
  • Data-Driven Decision Making
  • Continuous Improvement and Learning


Your Skills:


  • We are looking for experience in SQL for data manipulation, strong technical and analytical skills, and programming knowledge (Python/R).
  • You must demonstrate clear and capable communication and presentation skills as a consultant.
  • Tableau/Power BI, matplotlib
  • BSc or an MSc in a relevant topic such as Maths, Computer Science or Statistics, etc..

4136649377,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-sibling-4136649377?position=3&pageNum=0&refId=nvDgldexMyfBaltEj89nLA%3D%3D&trackingId=8RuYM7guOIXFTTn2KMxvqQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,SIBLING,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"Job Title: Data Analyst and Power BI Expert - Brussels

We are seeking a skilled and motivated Data Analyst and Power BI Expert to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, visualization, and modeling, combined with excellent technical expertise in Power BI and related tools. In this role, you will play a key part in transforming operational data into actionable insights, elevating the data proficiency of team members, and advising on the conceptualization of data architecture.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver tailored solutions.
Gather, analyze, and interpret complex datasets to provide actionable insights.
Develop and maintain Power BI dashboards and reports for data visualization and decision support.
Ensure data quality and integrity through regular verification and validation processes.
Propose and implement initiatives to increase data analytics awareness within the department.
Design and implement analytics models on operational data.
Support and mentor one or two colleagues from the P&O team in developing data analytics skills.
Contribute to the conceptualization and setup of the departmentâ€™s data architecture.
Leverage AI solutions to create advanced and insightful dashboards in Power BI.
Mastery of Power BI, including: Creating reports and dashboard and use of Power Query and DAX.
Strong data analysis skills, including identifying outliers, grouping, and bin data for in-depth insights.
Expertise in data modeling to structure data efficiently and establish relationships between tables.
Ability to select and apply appropriate data visualizations for clear and impactful communication.
If you are passionate about data analytics, thrive in a collaborative environment, and have a proven track record of leveraging data to drive decision-making, weâ€™d love to hear from you.

4137992947,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/stagiaire-data-analyst-at-chanel-4137992947?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=KRPmZz1wg7qx%2FoBxKJvQYQ%3D%3D&trackingId=BasiQMKDWpsc6MnkC0SIVg%3D%3D,Stagiaire Data Analyst,CHANEL,"Schwyz, Switzerland","As we are revamping our BI solutions, we need someone to help us catalog existing dashboards/reports and continuously improve them. The Data Analyst Intern will assist the Business Intelligence team in creating data visualizations and interactive reports for Chanel in the Swiss Markets. This role offers a chance to learn, grow, and contribute to meaningful projects in a dynamic work environment.
Conduct an assessment of existing BI solutions, rationalize or harmonize them if necessary.
Collaborate with business teams to understand visualization requirements and needs.
Assist in the design and the development of Power BI dashboards and reports.

Student in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or related field
Basic knowledge of BI tools, particularly Power BI
Knowledge of SQL language is a plus
Strong interest in the field of Business Intelligence and data analysis
Ability to work in a team and communicate effectively
Proactive and eager to learn and contribute to the team

As we are revamping our BI solutions, we need someone to help us catalog existing dashboards/reports and continuously improve them. The Data Analyst Intern will assist the Business Intelligence team in creating data visualizations and interactive reports for Chanel in the Swiss Markets. This role offers a chance to learn, grow, and contribute to meaningful projects in a dynamic work environment.


  • Conduct an assessment of existing BI solutions, rationalize or harmonize them if necessary.
  • Collaborate with business teams to understand visualization requirements and needs.
  • Assist in the design and the development of Power BI dashboards and reports.
  • Participate in the maintenance and improvement of existing BI solutions.
  • Contribute to the resolution of issues relative to data quality and data consistency across the different sources and global/regional BI solutions
  • Contribute to special projects and continuous improvement initiatives.


Job Profile


  • Student in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or related field

Immobiliare.it Mutui Ã¨ l'app N.1 dei mutui. Aiutiamo gratuitamente chi ha in mente l'acquisto di una casa a trovare il mutuo ideale. Ãˆ stata lanciata nel 2024, preceduta da Mutuiamo nel 2019. La nostra mission Ã¨ quella di eliminare l'ostacolo del mutuo per trasformarlo in uno strumento per chi vuole comprare casa.
Per farlo, abbiamo creato un ecosistema basato su 3 pilastri: i) innovazione tecnologica ii) esperti mutuo in-house e iii) banche leader come key partners.
Per questo motivo stiamo cercando un Business Intelligence Analyst da inserire nel nostro Team nella nostra sede operativa di Roma.
Interagire con i processi aziendali chiave per trasformare la direzione strategica in azioni
Estrapolare i dati dai nostri database
Analisi dei dati per fornire insights informativi attraverso strumenti di Data Visualization, Report e Dashboard interattive
Gestione degli applicativi e della tecnologia utilizzata dallâ€™azienda (es. CRM & software suite)
Analisi principali KPI di business per identificare tendenze, anomalie o opportunitÃ
Implementare automatismi per efficientamento dei processi interni
Utilizzo ed implementazione script in cloud di servizi API tramite Google Cloud Platform (GCP) e/o automatismi Web
Preparazione e condivisione di report da condividere con stakeholders interni ed esterni
Laureati in Economia, Statistica, Informatica, Fisica, Matematica, Ingegneria
Esperienza di almeno un anno nell'utilizzo di Python
Esperienza di almeno un anno nellâ€™utilizzo di SQL
Esperienza di almeno due anni in ambito di analisi dati e/o business intelligence
Goal â€“ oriented: attitudine a lavorare per obiettivi sfidanti

CapacitÃ  di agire in autonomia: Ti forniremo il â€œperchÃ¨â€ dietro determinate scelte strategiche, ma sta a te prendere lâ€™iniziativa e trovare il â€œcomeâ€ farlo. Qui, la tua capacitÃ  di agire in autonomia non solo Ã¨ benvenuta, ma essenziale.

Implementare delle soluzioni â€œquick&dirtyâ€ per testare le assumptions che emergono dalle analisi. Se migliorative sviluppare e scalare le soluzioni. Il nostro approccio: â€œPrima fallo funzionare, poi miglioraloâ€

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realise their financial goals and help them save time and money.
We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com
You will be part of a very dynamic and fast-growing Analytics team in Italy and you will develop analytical solutions to the benefit of our clients' and their customers.

The role holder must have experience (4-5 years at least) in the development of analytical projects in the field of credit risk management, anti-fraud modelling or Marketing. Experience in regulatory-driven analytics (AIRB, IFRS9) or experience in development of machine learning models (especially applied to credit and fraud risk management) will be a major plus.

Manage a team of analytical resources (Consultants Jr. Consultants, Analysts) in the development analytical solutions for different clients, specially in the financial sector â€“ this includes the development of statistical models and ad hoc data analysis
Understand the project's requirements and for communicating them to more junior staff
Ensure that project deliverables are accurate and meet project scope and goals
Question results through applied intelligence in a proactive way and interpret them into conclusions and recommendations to clients
Present the project results to clients or to more senior members of Experian
Participate in pre-sales and sales meetings with clients and prospects to describe and position Experian's analytics projects and propositions and to adapt it to our client's needs
Plan, organize and complete project work to meet team commitments within agreed timescales
Degree in quantitative subjects (e.g. mathematics, economics, statistics, engineering, or physics)
Good experience designing and implementing credit risk models
Knowledge of statistics and how statistical methodologies are employed in model development
Good knowledge one or more of other major statistical packages (e.g. Python, SAS, WPS, SPSS, or R)
Established track record (at least four years) of delivering complex analytical projects
Fluent in English â€“ both written and spoken with working proficiency
Great compensation package and bonus plan
Core benefits including health insurance, lunch vouchers and wellbeing benefits.
Our uniqueness is that we celebrate yours. Experian's culture and people are important differentiators. We take our people agenda very seriously and focus on what matters

column3: Great Place To Workâ„¢ in 24 countries, FORTUNE Best Companies to work and Glassdoor Best Places to Work (globally 4.4 Stars) to name a few. Check out Experian Life on social or our Careers Site to understand why.

Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realise their financial goals and help them save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com

Job Description

You will be part of a very dynamic and fast-growing Analytics team in Italy and you will develop analytical solutions to the benefit of our clients' and their customers.

The role holder must have experience (4-5 years at least) in the development of analytical projects in the field of credit risk management, anti-fraud modelling or Marketing. Experience in regulatory-driven analytics (AIRB, IFRS9) or experience in development of machine learning models (especially applied to credit and fraud risk management) will be a major plus.

Consultancy and Analytics

  • Manage a team of analytical resources (Consultants Jr. Consultants, Analysts) in the development analytical solutions for different clients, specially in the financial sector â€“ this includes the development of statistical models and ad hoc data analysis
  • Understand the project's requirements and for communicating them to more junior staff
  • Ensure that project deliverables are accurate and meet project scope and goals
  • Question results through applied intelligence in a proactive way and interpret them into conclusions and recommendations to clients
  • Present the project results to clients or to more senior members of Experian

Pre-sales and Sales support

  • Participate in pre-sales and sales meetings with clients and prospects to describe and position Experian's analytics projects and propositions and to adapt it to our client's needs

Project Management

  • Plan, organize and complete project work to meet team commitments within agreed timescales

Qualifications

  • Degree in quantitative subjects (e.g. mathematics, economics, statistics, engineering, or physics)
  • Technical and analytical skills
  • Good experience designing and implementing credit risk models
  • Knowledge of statistics and how statistical methodologies are employed in model development
  • Good knowledge one or more of other major statistical packages (e.g. Python, SAS, WPS, SPSS, or R)
  • Established track record (at least four years) of delivering complex analytical projects
  • Fluent in English â€“ both written and spoken with working proficiency
  • Benefits:
    • Great compensation package and bonus plan
    • Core benefits including health insurance, lunch vouchers and wellbeing benefits.
    • Flexible work environment, hybrid work.
Additional Information

Our uniqueness is that we celebrate yours. Experian's culture and people are important differentiators. We take our people agenda very seriously and focus on what matters

Saranno prese in considerazione tutte le candidature indistintamente, nel rispetto dei nostri valori ed in linea con la nostra cultura inclusiva.

#YourRole

In quanto Analyst avrai la possibilitÃ  di imparare dai colleghi piÃ¹ Senior (attraverso il learning on the job) e sviluppare competenze tecniche e relazionali lavorando in un contesto stimolante, che comporta sfide impegnative con ottime prospettive professionali.

In Particolare, Ti Occuperai Di

  • Analisi dati su basi dati relazionali e NoSQL
  • Utilizzo di strumenti quali SQL, Qlik, Excel, Python, Power Platform
  • Sviluppo e mantenimento di progetti di Data Analytics (DataBase, ETL, Reportistica)
  • Utilizzo dei tipici tool quali Visual Studio, Sql Server Management Studio.

Grazie allâ€™ufficio Learning avrai modo di seguire corsi e attivitÃ  di formazione che ti permetteranno di ampliare e approfondire le tue conoscenze.

I colleghi del Talent invece, si occuperanno in maniera strutturata del tuo avanzamento di carriera con KPI e obiettivi definiti, che se raggiunti, ti garantiranno la revisione del grade e degli economics.

#WinningRequirements

  • Laurea in Ingegneria, Informatica, Data Science
  • Spiccate capacitÃ  analitiche e attitudine al problem solving
  • Conoscenza dei concetti di organizzazione di un Data Warehouse
  • Propensione al lavoro in team
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese
  • Ottime capacitÃ  relazionali e comunicative.
  • #NiceToHave
  • Costituisce titolo preferenziale la conoscenza uno fra: SQL Server, Power BI, Qlik, Power Apps

#LoveWorkingAtDeloitteIf

  • Vorresti intraprendere una carriera professionale nel mondo della consulenza, dove la parola dâ€™ordine Ã¨: crescita
  • Lâ€™idea di trasformare un problema in opportunitÃ  ti stimola
  • Ti ritieni una persona empatica e quindi disponibile ad accogliere le diverse esigenze dei tuoi colleghi e degli stakeholder interni ed esterni
  • Ti piacerebbe imparare ad avere una visione progettuale dâ€™insieme, tenendo sempre a mente lâ€™operativitÃ  per raggiungere gli obiettivi con integritÃ  e rispetto degli standard Deloitte
  • Ti piace lavorare in un ambiente sfidante in cui le prioritÃ  possono cambiare quotidianamente
  • Ami lavorare in team
  • #MakeanImpactThatMatters

Siamo impegnati a ridurre i nostri impatti e incoraggiamo le persone ad assumere comportamenti sostenibili. Per salvaguardare lâ€™ambiente e limitare il climate change, abbiamo sviluppato la strategia WorldClimate, attraverso la quale ci siamo posti lâ€™obiettivo di diventare una Net Zero.

Join our #iAct movement! Fai il quiz per calcolare la tua carbon footprint e scopri come adottare dei comportamenti piÃ¹ responsabili.

Se vuoi scoprire come sarÃ  il processo di selezione, guarda questo video.

Se vuoi prepararti ad incontrare i nostri Recruiter iscriviti alla nostra piattaforma gratuita di orientamento al lavoro.

Si offre inserimento in stage di 6 mesi caratterizzato da un percorso di training ad alto valore formativo.

Sedi di lavoro: Milano, Cagliari, Roma.

4138990127,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/solution-area-specialist-data-ai-at-microsoft-4138990127?position=31&pageNum=0&refId=YXgXERr5kAE5vhdBAiqLug%3D%3D&trackingId=%2B%2FCxr%2FgR%2F581F0%2FTx6DqUQ%3D%3D,Solution Area Specialist - Data & AI,Microsoft,"Rome, Latium, Italy","The Data and AI team acts as trusted advisors and subject matter experts with core capability and expertise in Data Modernization, Analytics, and AI. We work with customers to leverage data and AI to help them achieve their business priorities and help guide customersâ€™ journey through Azure Data transformation. We also support customers in evaluating their applications and business requirements, recommend solutions that meet their requirements, and demonstrate these solutions to win the business and technical decision.

As a Data & AI Specialist you will be a solution sales expert within our enterprise sales organization working with our most important customers. You will collaborate with a team of technical, partner, and consulting resources to advance the sales process and exceed quarterly Data & AI revenue targets in your assigned accounts.

Microsoftâ€™s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

Brings impactful industry insights into customer engagements and closes deals with customers. Explores and assesses the needs of strategic/high-potential customers. Articulates business value and long-term implications for customer business. Develops strategies for driving and closing strategic and/or prioritized opportunities. Leads the planning and execution on opportunities with resources and partners to cross-sell and up-sell. Mentors others and develops strategies for best practice sharing across subsidiaries. Leverages and shares competitor knowledge across solution areas as a subject matter expert to inform decisions on pursuit or withdrawal. Coaches others on ensuring customer/partner satisfaction and decreasing dissatisfaction by establishing recovery action plans to improve clients' overall experience. Manages the end-to-end business for strategic accounts across the organization. Leads forecasting for accounts and develops a portfolio and territory plan to drive intentional selling with on-strategy engagements in high-propensity accounts. Mentors junior team members.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. 4143378090,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-0-experience-required-at-peroptyx-4143378090?position=36&pageNum=0&refId=YXgXERr5kAE5vhdBAiqLug%3D%3D&trackingId=KYazPouwfqkjRJTC5cDXsw%3D%3D,Data Analyst (0 Experience Required),Peroptyx,"Rome, Latium, Italy","For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.

At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.

As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.

With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.
So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!
Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Italy.
Must be living in Italy for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.

For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.


At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.


As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.


With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.


So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!


Benefits

  • Work up to 20 hours per week.
  • Earn a competitive rate of pay.
  • Develop your research skills.
  • Avoid the long commute.
  • Work from the comfort of your home office.
  • Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!


Ideal Candidate

  • Fluent in English and Italian.
  • Excellent research skills.
  • Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
  • Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Italy.
  • Analytical mindset.


Job Requirements

  • Must be living in Italy for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
  • Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
  • Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
  • Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
  • Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
  • All work must be of an independent nature.



Apply Online Today!

4128311269,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/trainee-data-analyst-career-accelerator-with-employment-guarantee-at-nuyew-tech-academy-4128311269?position=39&pageNum=0&refId=YXgXERr5kAE5vhdBAiqLug%3D%3D&trackingId=4LJ%2Bz9zc9u%2BG8AZzUwhuIQ%3D%3D,Trainee Data Analyst (Career Accelerator with Employment Guarantee),Nuyew Tech Academy,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Are you passionate about uncovering insights from data and driving informed decision-making? Are you looking for a structured training program that can kickstart your career in data analysis?
At Nuyew Tech Academy, we specialise in providing aspiring tech professionals like you with the tools, training, and support needed to launch successful careers in this vital industry.

Whether you're starting from scratch or looking to advance your existing skills, our academy offers a comprehensive program designed to cultivate your talent and propel you towards exciting opportunities in data analysis.
What the Data Analysis Career Accelerator at Nuyew Tech Academy includes and what students can expect:
Comprehensive Training: Receive in-depth training in data analysis tools and techniques, including Excel, Databases, Python, Power BI and AI.
Hands-on Experience: Opportunities to gain practical experience through real-world scenarios and virtual labs.

Industry-Recognised Certifications: Preparation for industry-recognised certifications such as CompTIA Data+, Microsoft Power BI Associate and Microsoft Excel Expert to validate skills and enhance employability.
Personalised Support: Dedicated student support team offering guidance, feedback, and support throughout the program to ensure student success.
Career Development: Tailored career guidance, resume building, interview preparation, and job search assistance to help students transition into data analyst roles.
Networking Opportunities: Access to networking events and alumni connections to expand professional networks and explore career opportunities.
Financial Support: Scholarship opportunities and interest free student loans available to make the program accessible and affordable for all aspiring data analyst professionals.
No previous experience or qualifications required
Strong interest in tech and data analysis
Ability to work independently and in a team environment
Detail-oriented and strong attention to accuracy and completeness
Willingness to learn and continuously improve technical and professional skills
Career Advancement: Elevate your professional journey with a tailored training course that's designed to set you on the path towards high-demand tech roles.

Competitive Salary Prospects: Upon completing our training and gaining some relevant experience, candidates are poised to secure roles with salaries aligned to what's advertised on the job listing. Invest in your future potential!

Employment Guarantee: If you haven't secured a tech job by course completion, we'll provide additional training and career support until you do. Still not employed after three years? We'll refund your tuition in full, and you keep your certifications. Your future in tech starts with us.
Professional Growth: Broaden your horizons and skill set with diverse professional development opportunities throughout and post-training.

Affordable Learning: We're committed to making education accessible. The academy career pathway tuition fee of Â£3995 can be funded by scholarship opportunities and interest free student loans which enable you to spread your tuition fee over 36 months.

Please Note: While we offer robust training and support to help candidates find employment, it's important to clarify that candidates will not be directly employed by Nuyew Tech Academy. Our commitment is to empower you with the skills and support needed to enhance your job prospects in the broader tech industry.

Are you passionate about uncovering insights from data and driving informed decision-making? Are you looking for a structured training program that can kickstart your career in data analysis?

At Nuyew Tech Academy, we specialise in providing aspiring tech professionals like you with the tools, training, and support needed to launch successful careers in this vital industry.

Whether you're starting from scratch or looking to advance your existing skills, our academy offers a comprehensive program designed to cultivate your talent and propel you towards exciting opportunities in data analysis.

What the Data Analysis Career Accelerator at Nuyew Tech Academy includes and what students can expect:

  • Comprehensive Training: Receive in-depth training in data analysis tools and techniques, including Excel, Databases, Python, Power BI and AI.
  • Hands-on Experience: Opportunities to gain practical experience through real-world scenarios and virtual labs.
  • Industry-Recognised Certifications: Preparation for industry-recognised certifications such as CompTIA Data+, Microsoft Power BI Associate and Microsoft Excel Expert to validate skills and enhance employability.
  • Personalised Support: Dedicated student support team offering guidance, feedback, and support throughout the program to ensure student success.
  • Career Development: Tailored career guidance, resume building, interview preparation, and job search assistance to help students transition into data analyst roles.
  • Networking Opportunities: Access to networking events and alumni connections to expand professional networks and explore career opportunities.
  • Financial Support: Scholarship opportunities and interest free student loans available to make the program accessible and affordable for all aspiring data analyst professionals.

Requirements

  • No previous experience or qualifications required
  • Strong interest in tech and data analysis
  • Ability to work independently and in a team environment
  • Detail-oriented and strong attention to accuracy and completeness
  • Willingness to learn and continuously improve technical and professional skills

Benefits

  • Career Advancement: Elevate your professional journey with a tailored training course that's designed to set you on the path towards high-demand tech roles.
  • Competitive Salary Prospects: Upon completing our training and gaining some relevant experience, candidates are poised to secure roles with salaries aligned to what's advertised on the job listing. Invest in your future potential!
  • Employment Guarantee: If you haven't secured a tech job by course completion, we'll provide additional training and career support until you do. Still not employed after three years? We'll refund your tuition in full, and you keep your certifications. Your future in tech starts with us.
  • Professional Growth: Broaden your horizons and skill set with diverse professional development opportunities throughout and post-training.
  • Dynamic Learning Environment: Experience a vibrant and supportive academy atmosphere where innovation meets education.
  • Affordable Learning: We're committed to making education accessible. The academy career pathway tuition fee of Â£3995 can be funded by scholarship opportunities and interest free student loans which enable you to spread your tuition fee over 36 months.

Please Note: While we offer robust training and support to help candidates find employment, it's important to clarify that candidates will not be directly employed by Nuyew Tech Academy. Our commitment is to empower you with the skills and support needed to enhance your job prospects in the broader tech industry.

We are the Lottomatica Group, leader in regulated gaming in Italy and one of the largest European operators, in all areas of activity: sports betting, online gaming and amusement machines. We offer our customers safe and quality gaming experiences, through all channels, putting responsibility and sustainability at the core of the business. Being in Lottomatica is much more than being part of a company: it means contributing to a great and responsible entrepreneurial project.

We are looking for a Data Engineer to join the Advanced Analytics Data Platform team for the development of data flows within the company's Data Platform and the distribution of integrated Artificial Intelligence solutions across all business areas.
At least 2 years of experience in the role
Familiarity with Apache Spark and the Hadoop ecosystem
Depending on seniority, the candidate will be responsible for one or more of the following activities:
Implementation of data consumption pipelines (export pipelines, APIs)
Basic knowledge of Bash and Unix operating systems
Familiarity with MongoDB and NoSQL databases
Experience with SQL Server and Integration Services (SSIS)
Experience in designing cloud-on-premise integration architectures
Expertise in database design, data access strategies and mechanisms, data security and integrity control, engineering services, and distributed systems
What you will find in Lottomatica:
Opportunity to work in the largest betting and gaming company in Italy and one of the largest in the world
Work in a dynamic environment and improve your skills while acquiring new ones
Being challenged to provide impactful solutions for large organisations and have a direct impact on their employees
Opportunity to participate in charity, legality and responsibility projects through engagement in Fondazione Lottomatica
A defined corporate DNA model in which Inclusion, Value of Diversity, Excellence and Collaboration are the pillars
Being part of the world's number one company in the industry for ESG commitment
Permanent contract and hybrid work opportunities
Continuous training on hard and soft skills
Annual gross salary commensurate with experience (40-45K)

Lottomatica implements a policy that guarantees equal opportunities and promotes diversity and inclusion, against all forms of discrimination. At Lottomatica we believe that each person is unique and we consider diversity as a source of personal and organizational enrichment. We strive every day for ours to be an open, safe and inclusive environment, where each person can be fully himself or herself regardless of gender, religion, sex, age, ethnicity, nationality, disability, marital status or sexual orientation.

4142347714,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-hybrid-at-imperial-brands-plc-4142347714?position=42&pageNum=0&refId=YXgXERr5kAE5vhdBAiqLug%3D%3D&trackingId=WY3ESCTqZ%2ByvEoNMbWjYiA%3D%3D,Data Analyst (Hybrid),Imperial Brands PLC,"Rome, Latium, Italy","The Role

Are you ready to be part of an inclusive and innovative global FMCG company? At Imperial Brands, we are supported by a diverse team of 25,000 employees worldwide, and we are looking for a talented Business Intelligence Specialist to join our dynamic team in Rome.
If you are passionate about data analysis and want to make a significant impact, we would love to hear from you. Apply now to join Imperial Brands and take your career to the next level!
Administration, updating, maintenance and development of existing Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and Business Intelligence (BI) systems, collaborating with offshore technical colleagues
Supporting Salesforce on the correct use of the Salesforce CRM system
Supporting internal stakeholders on the correct use of the BI system
Data mining, ensuring the constant alignment, integrity and consistency of company data
Proposing solutions on the optimisation of data analysis and visualisation
Ensuring data integrity, consistency and correct extraction
Preparation and management of reports, dashboards and KPIs aimed at data integration and analysis
Ad hoc performance analysis of Trade & Sales initiatives
Previous experience in the field of Business Intelligence / CRM administration.
Advanced knowledge of the Office packages, including advanced Excel
Knowledge of CRM and BI system architectures
Ability to team work and build effective relationships with different business functions
Strong analytical skills, passion for numbers and performance

In return for playing your part in building our future, you will receive a comprehensive compensation package with salary, bonus scheme and many extras including a great pension scheme, generous holiday entitlement and hybrid/flexible working opportunities as well inspiring places to work and collaborate with purpose. Here at Imperial we will give you the opportunity to grow and learn, innovate at pace and be a part of our purpose to forge a path to a healthier future for moments of relaxation and pleasure for our consumers.

Everyone belongs in Imperial. We are proud of being a truly inclusive organisation. We encourage and welcome applications from people of all ages, genders, ethnicities, nationalities, disabilities, sexual orientation, religions or beliefs and of neuro divergence. We give fair and equal consideration to all our applicants. Please contact us at recruitment@impbrands.com to let us know if we can provide support in helping you complete an application and/or attend an interview.

We're a truly international company, fourth largest in our industry and operating across 120 markets. An inclusive, innovative global FMCG business supported by 25,000 employees. As we embrace a new era of growth, we are transforming.

Our ways of working and culture are driven by a challenger mindset, constantly questioning the status quo where people can bring their best selves to work. Our agility and collaboration are driving our ambitions, innovation and success all supported by our award-winning development programmes that creates exciting and rewarding career opportunities for all.

Encouraging inclusion at local levels and supporting a developing and robust diversity agenda globally, weâ€™re fully committed to creating and maintaining an environment that celebrates and respects difference.
As a matter of policy, Imperial Tobacco or its subsidiaries never requests or requires payment as part of any recruitment process.

The Role


Are you ready to be part of an inclusive and innovative global FMCG company? At Imperial Brands, we are supported by a diverse team of 25,000 employees worldwide, and we are looking for a talented Business Intelligence Specialist to join our dynamic team in Rome.


If you are passionate about data analysis and want to make a significant impact, we would love to hear from you. Apply now to join Imperial Brands and take your career to the next level!



Principal Accountabilities


  • Administration, updating, maintenance and development of existing Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and Business Intelligence (BI) systems, collaborating with offshore technical colleagues
  • Supporting Salesforce on the correct use of the Salesforce CRM system
  • Supporting internal stakeholders on the correct use of the BI system
  • Data mining, ensuring the constant alignment, integrity and consistency of company data
  • Proposing solutions on the optimisation of data analysis and visualisation
  • Ensuring data integrity, consistency and correct extraction
  • Preparation and management of reports, dashboards and KPIs aimed at data integration and analysis
  • Ad hoc performance analysis of Trade &
column2:
Sales initiatives



Skills and Experience Required


  • Previous experience in the field of Business Intelligence / CRM administration.
  • Advanced knowledge of the Office packages, including advanced Excel
  • Knowledge of CRM and BI system architectures
  • Fluent English (both spoken and written)
  • Ability to team work and build effective relationships with different business functions
  • Strong analytical skills, passion for numbers and performance



What We Offer


In return for playing your part in building our future, you will receive a comprehensive compensation package with salary, bonus scheme and many extras including a great pension scheme, generous holiday entitlement and hybrid/flexible working opportunities as well inspiring places to work and collaborate with purpose. Here at Imperial we will give you the opportunity to grow and learn, innovate at pace and be a part of our purpose to forge a path to a healthier future for moments of relaxation and pleasure for our consumers.



Everyone Belongs


Everyone belongs in Imperial. We are proud of being a truly inclusive organisation. We encourage and welcome applications from people of all ages, genders, ethnicities, nationalities, disabilities, sexual orientation, religions or beliefs and of neuro divergence. We give fair and equal consideration to all our applicants. Please contact us at recruitment@impbrands.com to let us know if we can provide support in helping you complete an application and/or attend an interview.



About Us


We're a truly international company, fourth largest in our industry and operating across 120 markets. An inclusive, innovative global FMCG business supported by 25,000 employees. As we embrace a new era of growth, we are transforming.


Our ways of working and culture are driven by a challenger mindset, constantly questioning the status quo where people can bring their best selves to work. Our agility and collaboration are driving our ambitions, innovation and success all supported by our award-winning development programmes that creates exciting and rewarding career opportunities for all.


Encouraging inclusion at local levels and supporting a developing and robust diversity agenda globally, weâ€™re fully committed to creating and maintaining an environment that celebrates and respects difference.


As a matter of policy, Imperial Tobacco or its subsidiaries never requests or requires payment as part of any recruitment process.

4074546905,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-analytics-engineer-at-immobiliare-it-4074546905?position=43&pageNum=0&refId=YXgXERr5kAE5vhdBAiqLug%3D%3D&trackingId=fYs%2FtucWaNsaMGXMAQ4KFQ%3D%3D,Junior Data Analytics Engineer,Immobiliare.it,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Immobiliare.it is the Digital Tech Company leader in Italy among real estate portals. Our web and mobile products are developed in-house and every day we work to offer the best platform to publish and search for real estate listings, to evaluate properties and keep informed on housing market trends and news.
Innovation, technological excellence and attention for the user are the values that allow us to reach our objectives and continuously grow.
We are looking for a Junior Data Analytics Engineer to join our Marketing team.
marketing analytics: measurement of marketing campaigns with a focus on causality, optimization and data-driven decision-making
data management and architecture: data warehousing and big data analytics using cloud technologies (GCP, AWS) and open-source tools (Airflow, dataform, dbt)
data pipelines: design and manage reliable marketing data pipelines to provide new insights and detect threats and opportunities

data products: build end-to-end marketing data products combining internal data with several external sources like market and industry trends (e.g. market data, Google searches, online research) and competitive intelligence tools (e.g. Similarweb, data.ai, Semrush).
new graduate in Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Physics
analytical mindset with a problem solving approach
curious and passionate about marketing and tech platforms
fluent in English and working knowledge of Italian.
Our team is responsible for all marketing activities of our Group: Immobiliare.it (Italy), Indomio.es (Spain), Immotop.lu (Luxembourg), Crozilla.com (Croatia) and LuxuryEstate (Global)

performance marketing: we design, create and manage campaigns with different business objectives (e.g. user acquisition and engagement, lead generation and brand awareness). We are one of the top advertisers in our markets, we collaborate with the best partners and our strong relationship with them allow us to develop ad-hoc projects and to access new features, products and technologies before theyâ€™re widely released

analytics: Our products generate hundreds of millions of events every day, by analysing these interactions we can learn about our customers and their experience, optimise marketing investments, uncover new opportunities, and support data-driven decision-making.

market and competitor insights: we study the real estate market and our industry to uncover emerging trends, discover business opportunities and forecast demand as accurately as possible to stay ahead of the curve
projects: we drive growth, operational and technological improvements working cross-team and cross-competence (Tech, Product, Sales, PR & Content teams).
a young and dynamic work environment
an opportunity in a fast-growing company
paid internship contract or fixed contract
free coffee and fresh fruit every day
break room with a foosball table
office located in the centre of Rome (Termini).
This announcement is addressed to people of any sex, pursuant to laws 903/77 and 125/91, and to people of all ages and all nationalities, pursuant to legislative decrees 215/03 and 216/03.

Immobiliare.it is the Digital Tech Company leader in Italy among real estate portals. Our web and mobile products are developed in-house and every day we work to offer the best platform to publish and search for real estate listings, to evaluate properties and keep informed on housing market trends and news.

Innovation, technological excellence and attention for the user are the values that allow us to reach our objectives and continuously grow.


We are looking for a Junior Data Analytics Engineer to join our Marketing team.


What you will learn:

  • marketing analytics: measurement of marketing campaigns with a focus on causality, optimization and data-driven decision-making
column2: • data management and architecture: data warehousing and big data analytics using cloud technologies (GCP, AWS) and open-source tools (Airflow, dataform, dbt)
column3: • data pipelines: design and manage reliable marketing data pipelines to provide new insights and detect threats and opportunities
column4:
• data products: build end-to-end marketing data products combining internal data with several external sources like market and industry trends (e.g. market data, Google searches, online research) and competitive intelligence tools (e.g. Similarweb, data.ai, Semrush).


    • Who you are:

    • new graduate in Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Physics
column5: • analytical mindset with a problem solving approach
column6: • curious and passionate about marketing and tech platforms
column7:
• fluent in English and working knowledge of Italian.


    • Nice-to-have skills:

    • experience with Python and SQL
column8:
• familiarity with Google Cloud Platform.


    • About our team:

    Our team is responsible for all marketing activities of our Group: Immobiliare.it (Italy), Indomio.es (Spain), Immotop.lu (Luxembourg), Crozilla.com (Croatia) and LuxuryEstate (Global)

    We focus mainly on:

    • performance marketing: we design, create and manage campaigns with different business objectives (e.g. user acquisition and engagement, lead generation and brand awareness). We are one of the top advertisers in our markets, we collaborate with the best partners and our strong relationship with them allow us to develop ad-hoc projects and to access new features, products and technologies before theyâ€™re widely released
column9:
• analytics: Our products generate hundreds of millions of events every day, by analysing these interactions we can learn about our customers and their experience, optimise marketing investments, uncover new opportunities, and support data-driven decision-making.
  • market and competitor insights: we study the real estate market and our industry to uncover emerging trends, discover business opportunities and forecast demand as accurately as possible to stay ahead of the curve
column10: • projects: we drive growth, operational and technological improvements working cross-team and cross-competence (Tech, Product, Sales, PR &
column11:
Content teams).


What we offer:

  • a young and dynamic work environment
column12: • an opportunity in a fast-growing company
column13: • paid internship contract or fixed contract
column14: • ticket restaurants
column15: • free coffee and fresh fruit every day
column16: • break room with a foosball table
column17:
• office located in the centre of Rome (Termini).


    • This announcement is addressed to people of any sex, pursuant to laws 903/77 and 125/91, and to people of all ages and all nationalities, pursuant to legislative decrees 215/03 and 216/03.

We are the Lottomatica Group, leader in regulated gaming in Italy and one of the largest European operators, in all areas of activity: sports betting, online gaming and amusement machines. We offer our customers safe and quality gaming experiences, through all channels, putting responsibility and sustainability at the core of the business. Being in Lottomatica is much more than being part of a company: it means contributing to a great and responsible entrepreneurial project.

We are looking, for a Group Company, for a profile as Data Scientist that will join the Betting & Digital Italy Department and will be involved in conducting quantitative analysis aimed at monitoring the behaviour of the customer base and the performance of online products.
Previous experience in the role in structured contexts
University degree and/or master's degree in statistics/mathematics
Passion for numbers and strong analytical skills
Aptitude for problem solving and propensity to work in a team
Excellent command of the MS Office suite (in particular, advanced use of MS Excel and PowerPoint is required)
Knowledge of SQL programming languages, Python
Good knowledge of the English language
The following will be a plus
Knowledge of data visualisation tools: Power BI
Previous experience in the Gaming and/or Digital sectors
Opportunity to work in the largest betting and gaming company in Italy and one of the largest in the world
Work in a very dynamic environment and improve your skills while acquiring new ones
Being challenged to provide impactful solutions for large organisations and have a direct impact on their employees
Opportunity to participate in charity, legality and responsibility projects through engagement in Fondazione Lottomatica
A defined corporate DNA model where Inclusion, Value of Diversity, Excellence and Collaboration are the pillars
Being part of the world's number one company in the industry for ESG commitment
Permanent contract and hybrid job opportunity
Company welfare, supplementary health insurance, nursery bonus
Ongoing training on hard skills and soft skills
Gross annual salary commensurate with experience (from 26k a 30k)

Project Location: Remote from Belgium, France, Germany, Italy, or Switzerland.
Engagement Model: One-time task, task based
We are currently looking for contributors to participate in our Wharf remote project!

This project aims at collecting text messages, emails, and emails with attachments that you have received for booking confirmations, changes, or cancellations related to Belgium and Switzerland after November 2022.
The collection purpose is to help improve and test features, services, and algorithms by training advanced machine learning systems such as neural networks and generative models.

You can submit personal text messages, emails, and emails with attachments in French (for bookings related to Belgium or Switzerland), German or Italian (for bookings related to Switzerland) from a variety of categories:
Travel: Flights, Hotels, Car rentals, Ticketed ground transport (e.g., train, bus, ferry)
Entertainment: Tickets for movies, shows, sports and other events, Party invitations originating from event providers

Appointments: Doctor appointments, dentist appointments, personal care appointments (e.g., oral hygienist, physical therapist, etc.), appointments for family members (e.g., childrenâ€™s doctor appointments).

Using our DataForce proprietary platform, you will share assets (text messages, emails, and emails with attachments) from your personal computer (desktop or laptop) or mobile device, according to the instructions that will be shared with you if you qualify for the project.
You can submit as many assets as you wish for the open categories.
Our team will identify and remove any personal information (e.g., your name) contained in your assets before they are used in our project.
You will receive $3.5 USD per each accepted asset, via PayPal, Gift Card or Wire Transfer, according to your preference.
If you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to reach out to us at: DataForce.Sourcing@transperfect.com

DataForce by TransPerfect is part of the TransPerfect family of companies, the worldâ€™s largest provider of language and technology solutions for global business, with offices in more than 100 cities worldwide.

We offer high-quality data for Human-Machine Interaction to some of the most prestigious technology companies in the world. Our division focuses on gathering, enriching and processing data for Machine Learning in different AI domains.
To learn more about DataForce please visit us at https://www.transperfect.com/dataforce

Position: Data Contributor

Project Location: Remote from Belgium, France, Germany, Italy, or Switzerland.

Engagement Model: One-time task, task based


We are currently looking for contributors to participate in our Wharf remote project!


What is the project about?

This project aims at collecting text messages, emails, and emails with attachments that you have received for booking confirmations, changes, or cancellations related to Belgium and Switzerland after November 2022.


The collection purpose is to help improve and test features, services, and algorithms by training advanced machine learning systems such as neural networks and generative models.


You can submit personal text messages, emails, and emails with attachments in French (for bookings related to Belgium or Switzerland), German or Italian (for bookings related to Switzerland) from a variety of categories:


Travel: Flights, Hotels, Car rentals, Ticketed ground transport (e.g., train, bus, ferry)
column2: Entertainment: Tickets for movies, shows, sports and other events, Party invitations originating from event providers
column3:
Appointments: Doctor appointments, dentist appointments, personal care appointments (e.g., oral hygienist, physical therapist, etc.), appointments for family members (e.g., childrenâ€™s doctor appointments).


Task Description

Using our DataForce proprietary platform, you will share assets (text messages, emails, and emails with attachments) from your personal computer (desktop or laptop) or mobile device, according to the instructions that will be shared with you if you qualify for the project.

You can submit as many assets as you wish for the open categories.


Our team will identify and remove any personal information (e.g., your name) contained in your assets before they are used in our project.

Compensation

You will receive $3.5 USD per each accepted asset, via PayPal, Gift Card or Wire Transfer, according to your preference.


If you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to reach out to us at: DataForce.Sourcing@transperfect.com


***

DataForce by TransPerfect is part of the TransPerfect family of companies, the worldâ€™s largest provider of language and technology solutions for global business, with offices in more than 100 cities worldwide.

We offer high-quality data for Human-Machine Interaction to some of the most prestigious technology companies in the world. Our division focuses on gathering, enriching and processing data for Machine Learning in different AI domains.

To learn more about DataForce please visit us at https://www.transperfect.com/dataforce

The chance to build a better future is right in front of you
Do Work That Matters â€“ Your Role and Responsibilities

Are you looking for meaningful and impactful work? At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, society, and your colleagues tackle and solve some of todayâ€™s most pressing and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory provides consulting services to support businesses in transforming their business models, improving and digitalizing processes, analyzing and managing risks, and assisting in extraordinary financial operations.

As part of the Enterprise Platform Team, you will engage in managing corporate change processes. Alongside experienced colleagues, you will analyze strategic requirements to implement the best digital solutions available on the market for integrated process management.
Design, develop, and optimize advanced dashboards and reports using Power BI, transforming complex data into clear and actionable insights while ensuring high performance and optimized data models.
Collaborate with business teams to understand their requirements, translate them into tailored solutions, and integrate Power BI with technologies like SQL Server, Azure, and Excel.
Ensure data accuracy and quality through structured checks, developing DAX measures and advanced queries for customized analyses and effective visualizations.
Provide support and training to users, enhancing the adoption of Power BI solutions, and monitor performance to optimize existing solutions.

You will be involved in both national and international projects, collaborating with highly qualified professionals and working closely with public sector clients, including government agencies, local administrations, and public organizations.
Come As You Are â€“ Your Skills and Characteristics
This opportunity is perfect for you if:
You have 2-4 years of experience with Power BI, including DAX and data modeling (star schema, snowflake).
You are familiar with SQL, relational databases, and integration tools such as ETL, data flows, and APIs.
You have experience with cloud platforms like Azure and integrating Power BI with other applications.
You have strong English proficiency, preferably supported by study and/or work experiences abroad.
You are willing to travel nationally and internationally to collaborate with clients throughout the project lifecycle.
Your Future With Us â€“ What Youâ€™ll Find at KPMG
An inclusive and equitable workplace that respects, encourages, and values diversity.
A stimulating and dynamic environment that fosters creativity and teamwork.
A hybrid working model to promote a healthy work-life balance.
Advanced training and development programs to stay up-to-date.
An international mindset and innovative projects.
Initiatives focused on physical and mental well-being.
Together for Better â€“ Our Values and Commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect for individuality, continuous learning, transparency, community engagement, and integrity: these are KPMGâ€™s values, creating an environment open to the exchange of ideas and knowledge, enabling professionals to reach their full potential.

Thanks to our commitment to fostering an inclusive workplace, our network has obtained ISO 30415 certification, which certifies compliance with the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125 certification, which certifies gender equality.
Our Impact Plan â€“ Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) â€“ summarizes the concrete actions we are taking on environmental, social, and governance (ESG) topics.

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) No. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ""GDPR"") and subsequent amendments. For more information, please consult KPMG's privacy policy.
KPMG Advisory S.p.A. guarantees equal opportunities.

4138990127,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/solution-area-specialist-data-ai-at-microsoft-4138990127?position=6&pageNum=2&refId=tqf6u68Q74Z%2F848%2FbnfJ2w%3D%3D&trackingId=8Ah0QxCvu%2FHHyxhjRkXdyg%3D%3D,Solution Area Specialist - Data & AI,Microsoft,"Rome, Latium, Italy","The Data and AI team acts as trusted advisors and subject matter experts with core capability and expertise in Data Modernization, Analytics, and AI. We work with customers to leverage data and AI to help them achieve their business priorities and help guide customersâ€™ journey through Azure Data transformation. We also support customers in evaluating their applications and business requirements, recommend solutions that meet their requirements, and demonstrate these solutions to win the business and technical decision.

As a Data & AI Specialist you will be a solution sales expert within our enterprise sales organization working with our most important customers. You will collaborate with a team of technical, partner, and consulting resources to advance the sales process and exceed quarterly Data & AI revenue targets in your assigned accounts.

Microsoftâ€™s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

Brings impactful industry insights into customer engagements and closes deals with customers. Explores and assesses the needs of strategic/high-potential customers. Articulates business value and long-term implications for customer business. Develops strategies for driving and closing strategic and/or prioritized opportunities. Leads the planning and execution on opportunities with resources and partners to cross-sell and up-sell. Mentors others and develops strategies for best practice sharing across subsidiaries. Leverages and shares competitor knowledge across solution areas as a subject matter expert to inform decisions on pursuit or withdrawal. Coaches others on ensuring customer/partner satisfaction and decreasing dissatisfaction by establishing recovery action plans to improve clients' overall experience. Manages the end-to-end business for strategic accounts across the organization. Leads forecasting for accounts and develops a portfolio and territory plan to drive intentional selling with on-strategy engagements in high-propensity accounts. Mentors junior team members.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. Il team segue progetti di lungo, medio e breve termine, con attivitÃ  quali:

Lavorare in BIP Ã¨ un'esperienza sfidante, in cui il merito paga e l'innovazione avviene attraverso idee coraggiose, collaborazione e un rapporto di fiducia con i nostri clienti.Â

Avrai la possibilitÃ  di metterti alla prova in contesti progettuali diversi in termini di ambito, natura delle attivitÃ  e stakeholders coinvolti. Vedrai valorizzato il tuo spirito di iniziativa, la tua passione, lâ€™autonomia e la capacitÃ  di assumerti responsabilitÃ  e metterti in gioco.
